characters: EXT . SALLY PORT, (COOK COW TY JAIL)

dialogues.speaker: CREDITS BEGIN OVER
dialogues.text: Snow swirls around the tall buildings of downtown Chicago

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars, taxis, limos line the street. A cab pulls up and MA in tuxedo moves into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH arriving guests we PICK UP the Man climbing stair to the ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: COAT CHECK
dialogues.text: The Man hands his coat to coat check woman and thanks her When he turns we get our first view of DR. RICHARD KIMBLE a tall, athletic man, with a trim beard. He moves from the outer lobby into a fabulously decorated ballroom where a fashion show is taking place as a medica fundraiser. Doctors and their spouses, hospital brass and sponsors mingle. Women sit near the runway watching the  models. Men talk by the bar. The room is packed. A banner over the rostrum says: "CHILDREN'S RESEARCH AND

dialogues.speaker: AID FOUNDATION"
dialogues.text: Kimble is handed a glass of champagne, which he promptly  sets on another waiter's passing tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard... DR. ROBERTS, a large surgeon, pulls Kimble over to a grou of surgeons gathered around a bar. Smoking cigars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancun. Nat just talked everybody  into it... A hospital equipment rep, NAT, is buying drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's the deal? If the hospital  buys ten new -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no strings attached, Dr.  Kimble. Industrial Hospital Supply  has no ulterior motives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the house, huh? (to bartender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonic water with lime. Everyone agrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never get me to sell my soul for one of those trips... His tone silences the group. Kimble takes his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But if you get any more Bulls  tickets, Nat, give me a call. The group laughs, Kimble extracts himself and CREDITS

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Moving through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Nearly gets hit in the follow-through of an imaginary  golf swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're slicing, Dave. Don't turn  your hip. He keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Richard...

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH-LOOKING LAB RAT
dialogues.text: KATHY WAHLUND, totally out of her element amid the formal elegance around her. She wears a leather jacket over  T-shirt and stares at the action on the fashion runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dripping sarcasm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you talked me into  coming, Richard... I can pick my cruise wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for a good cause, Kath...  Besides you need to get out of the lab more. Your electron microscope is starting to give you a tan. She smiles. He moves on.

dialogues.speaker: PARTY
dialogues.text: Kimble continues down the bar when he spots a friend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jim. DR. JAMES NICHOLS turns, smiles. Mid-40s, head of the  University Hospital. He is a fit contemporary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, I just saw someone who  wanted to meet you... Just then Kimble spots an attractive WOMAN, late thirties wearing a drop-dead, simple black gown. She's surrounded a group of men hanging on her every word. She and Kimble  catch a look and hold it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Kimble... Alex Lentz. Alex is working on the RDU90 trials for  Devlin-Macgregor. Kimble turns to meet DR. ALEXANDER LENTZ, late 30s, tan,  smiling. Lentz extends his hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kimble... Sorry, we've been  trading phone calls last few days  ... something about a biopsy report  I returned to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly attentive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Three. Livers appeared  hepatetic to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in my office in the morning  and I'll pull up the samples. Is that  a good time for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds Kimble's look,  then to Nichols)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you, Jim. Lentz moves on. Kimble looks after him a beat, then focus on relocating the Woman he just saw. She's gone. He and  Nichols move together through the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (digs in his pocket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I forget, I went by the garage this afternoon and picket up the  Ferrari. Thanks for the loaner again. He hands Kimble a valet ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fix it this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see. They reach the Woman Kimble saw, his wife, HELEN KIMBLE.  Kimble kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look fabulous, Helen. He kisses Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kimble)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a court tomorrow at three. Nichols leaves. Kimble looks at his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've seen everyone, can we  leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be a little abrupt, don't  you think?

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE'S TABLE
dialogues.text: A table for ten. Kimble and Helen introduce themselves to others at table ant sit across from each other. Kimble sits between two doctors' wives. One, NOW EAU WIFE mid-thirties, bedecked in jewels and loud dress, the othe OLDER WIFE. Helen sits between their husbands who are trying to impre her with the details of their boring studies as CREDITS  CONTINUE... INTERCUTTING WITH the fashion, catches of dialog and cour changes, Kimble and Helen demonstrate an oft-used exchang of glances: Kimble, while gracious to his dinner partners catches Helen's eye and makes smiling, subtle movements t his watch or a look to the door to indicate he's clearly  ready to leave. On the receiving end, Helen, the gatekeep of their social propriety, indicates with equal subtlety: "not yet." As we MOVE AROUND the table we hear: "Where's your husband on staff?" "My husband's an orthopo at Northwestern." "I'm working on a new technique..."  "That's fascinating..." "That's quite a marvelous dress  you're wearing." "Do you like it? My husband says it's a  'four-fracture number."' "Honey." (A look from her husban Kimble shares a look with Helen. He subtly motions to his watch: time go to, and mouths the word: "now." She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told my husband that he was going  to kill us if he didn't stop  operating. What with this AIDS thing,  he's putting us all at risk. Helen and Kimble absorb this comment without reaction, sh a look. Helen mouths the word: "Now."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her dinner partners)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I have to get my husband  home. They say their good-byes and pass Nichols' table. Nichols shakes his friend's hand in passing. From across the room see Lentz watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble and Helen driving home. She runs her fingers throu his hair as he drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looked handsome tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... He smiles to himself, seems to enjoy the compliment too m for Helen. Her smile becomes playful, mischievous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, huh... most men in a tuxedo look  like waiters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looked more like... a band  director. He stops at red light, leans over and kisses her. Light  changes and neither notice. Slowly their kiss breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we home yet?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble pulls up in front of his house. Suddenly both his  PAGER and CAR PHONE RING at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kimble (suddenly attentive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? Okay, tell them I'll be there  in ten minutes. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim's got a problem. Helen kisses him again, opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me on your way home. CREDITS END as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble, wearing scrubs but without head gear, moves down  stairs to the OR hall. He sticks his head into the operating room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavalry's here. Two harried surgeons look up, glad to see him.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUB ROOM
dialogues.text: Kimble begins scrubbing as the RESIDENT comes out to brin him up to speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patient is a male, forty-three. We  pulled his gall bladder and the  bleeding started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his pro time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's at 36 seconds. We got a major  bleeder in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk to the family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None. He's off the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operation in progress. Top medical facility filled with  trained professionals and state of the art equipment. Kim is assisted across the table by the chief Resident. Both  working so intently they never look at each other as they talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Anesthesiologist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I'm clamping. Can he  tolerate it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a very sick guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have a choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie, give me a clamp... MARIE, the scrub nurse, passes him the instrument and Kim and the other SURGEON continue to work with the Resident  assisting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (never looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband know you're here tonight, Marie?... What about this liver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: History's sketchy. Could be an  alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who referred him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on a drug protocol. RDU90. Kimble looks up and shares a look with the chief Resident over their masks, then back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wave of the future... Marie, you  told Frank yet? Frank is so jealous  of this late night thing we've got  going here... This should hold him.  Bleeding's stopped. Let's get a  biopsy... (to circulating nurse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send it downstairs and make sure you  get Kath her slice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You staying for the closing, Rich? Kimble moves away and sheds his gloves and gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I got a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble throws away his hat and mask. The door opens behin him; it is the other Surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Richard... Kimble turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble driving through empty Chicago streets toward home. He is on phone, waits for answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm five minutes away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen on the phone, downstairs. She is still in her gown an afghan around her shoulders. She's been reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad it went well. I'll see you  in a minute. Helen hangs up phone, turns out the light and starts up t stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen moves down the hall toward the dressing room/closet Opens the door to large closet dressing room and turns on the light. Nothing. She starts to leave and decides to cl one of the interior closet doors. She starts to slide the door closed when - wham! A hand reaches out and clutches her by the neck. Helen  claws and scratches to get free and in her struggle her  string of pearls bursts... ... and a single pearl bounces out of the bedroom... roll across the landing to the stairs, stopping three steps fr the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow swirls around the street as Kimble's car pulls into driveway. On the third floor, we see a bedroom light stil on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GRANDFATHER CLOCK TICKS softly. Kimble tosses his keys the entry table, picks up a stack of mail on the table an calls up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm home. Did you hear who won the  Bulls game? No answer. He steps into the:

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: The wall phone shows a line in use. Kimble notices it. Th WASHER BUZZES, he switches the clothes from washer to dry and STARTS the MACHINE. Takes a bottle of wine and two  glassesand leaves the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: .38 SMITH AND WESSON
dialogues.text: Lies on the floor, beside Helen's legs and the receiver o phone, off the hook. A man's rubber-gloved hand picks up gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble starts up the stairs to the bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen's hand reaches out presses the cradle down, dials

dialogues.speaker: ON KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Climbing the stairs... suddenly stops. A small white ball on the stairs. He bends down and picks it up... a pearl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen? Silence. He can see directly into the bedroom. It's quiet Too quiet. He notices a lampshade on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS HALL
dialogues.text: Kimble moves slowly to the opened doorway. And just befor he enters he sees a large form in the crack behind the do Adrenal surge. Kimble slams the door back on the figure knocking the gun free. Before Kimble can move to it a forearm flattens him The attacker immediately goes for the gun. Kimble grabs a leg and twists him down, the man's fingers hit the gun,  sending it skittering across the hardwood floor of the  landing and over the edge - three flights to the entry  hall below. SIRENS can be heard. Distant but APPROACHING. The man kicks free and tries to flee. This time Kimble  catches an arm and twists it at an unnatural angle. To hi shock, the limb detaches between the shoulder and elbow. Kimble looks at the arm in his hands - it's hollow.  Electrodes are visible inside - then to the man's unreada face... The SIRENS are LOUDER... Before Kimble can recover, the One-Armed Man knocks Kimbl down and grabs back his arm. He runs down the stairs. Kimble pulls himself up and starts to follow but is stopp by a VOICE behind him in the bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here... still in the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying by the bed, Helen Kimble, clutches the phone with o hand, her head with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I hear you right? Your attacker  is still in the house? Ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to kill me... Kimble appears. Helen drops the phone when she sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you repeat that please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kimble)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard... He's trying to kill me...  my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Chicago police cars wheel to the curb, COPS move quic to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves to her. Sees the necklace of bruises where s was held down and choked. And then a bullet wound in her  leg. She's already going into shock. Her speech turns thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, babe... going to be all  right. Her fingernails dig into Kimble's arm, trying to hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My head. Richard my hold me. Her eyes slip away from his. He peels away the hand on he head - and sees raw pummeled brain staring back and reali she won't be all right. CAMERA SWINGS DOWN TO the dropped phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hello. You said his name is  Richard? Ma'am, can you talk to me?  Ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops enter the house. See the .38 lying on the floor. Covering each other, they move quickly up the stairs - gu drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third floor. The First Cop, gun drawn, turns the corner o Kimble's bedroom and finds: Kimble holding his dead wife. Blood on his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble, numbed by the event, washes the blood off his han in the kitchen sink. A cop takes his blood-stained tux  jacket, and another hands him a parka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is filled with Chicago police cars, curious  neighbors, television news vans, etc. Kimble is helped into a police car as the coroner's van  arrives. He pauses a moment to watch as we hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give us a little more to go  on besides the fact that he had an  artificial arm? What kind of gun was it, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FINDS Kimble in an interview room. He is in "why"  shock. "Why her." "Why me?" Says nothing. Two Detectives: KELLY and ROSETTI. Kelly, the questioner, is overweight,  aggressive. He shifts his gun on his hip so he can sit do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was .38... I think. I only saw it  for a second. I knocked it out of  his hand. As Kimble is questioned we INTERCUT WITH flashes of the  murder scene being processed:

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Forensics technicians photograph the .38 at the base of t stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you own a gun, Dr. Kimble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A .38 Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have your key with you tonight,  Dr. Kimble?

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Checking doors of house for signs of forcible entry.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: PHONE RINGS. Rosetti answers it. Kimble watches him write something down, he slides it to Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE KELLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Your wife was loaded wasn't she? I mean, she was worth qu a bit of money.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kimble looks up at the two cops. For the first time he se to sense something aggressive in their questioning. They no longer seem on the same team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here? This guy was  trying to rob us. The two cops stare at Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys have got to be out of your  minds. I didn't kill my wife! He gets up to go. A cop blocks his path. He turns and loo at Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's start over, Dr. Kimble. What'd  you have for breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble in his tuxedo shirt and black tie holds a booking  number plate in front of him as a mug shot is taken...  front, then side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all adults here so I'll lay it out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicago Sun-Times has a photograph of Kimble spread acros the front page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... If you two come up with a deal,  I'll listen, but let me make one  thing perfectly clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salesmen continue to hawk sets. Kimble's photograph comes up on a hundred TV monitors across the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police are revealing no details in  the case against Chicago surgeon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble lays on his bunk. Thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's an election year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES THROUGH smoke-fillet room to find tough FEMA PROSECUTOR, a man in late forties, WALTER GUTHERIE, and S ON the source of the voice we've been hearing and the cig JUDGE BENNETT, late fifties. Fair but, no nonsense, polit survivor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and this case is a heater. It  will not end up a bench trial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Kimble in County lockup fatigues and a navy watch moves down long corridor, escorted by GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had private investigators  interview over a hundred amputees,  Richard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Gutherie, his attorney, stands by a window looking out at the yard. Another attorney, RANDOLPH, watches  Gutherie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... We can't find this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I saw, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put you up on the stand to say what  you saw without anything that  remotely smells like proof and the  State's attorney is going to take  this one-armed man story and run it  up our ass. (he holds Kimble's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Richard, you're paying us a  lot of money to defend you... A plea to second degree -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble being escorted back to the courtroom. A guard carr his suit in a bag. He is taunted by other prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a successful upper middle  class white man charged in a  violent crime...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the door is the courtroom. A sheriff deputy hands Kimble (now wearing his suit), a small plast bag. In it we see his wedding band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a circumstantial case, but it's  also a jury trial. We play 'em, they  play 'em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Kimble sits at defense table... watches prosecuto chat with Helen's relatives. Media anchors glare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But if we lose, we lose big.  Just remember, they're lined up a  block long to have your hide.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPH OF HELEN KIMBLE'S BODY
dialogues.text: A crime scene photograph.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE KELLY
dialogues.text: On the stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No forcible entry was found. From  the beginning of the investigation,  it did not appear to be a break-in.  Nothing was missing.

dialogues.speaker: FORENSICS TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: On the stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defendant's prints were found on the neck, gun, bullets, and lamp...  no other sets were fount other than  the deceased.

dialogues.speaker: FACES OF THE JURY
dialogues.text: Impassive. Attentive. His "peers." They listen to the  recording of the 911 tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I hear you right? Your attacker  is still in the house? Ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trving to kill me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you repeat that please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard... He's trying to kill me...

dialogues.speaker: THE JURY
dialogues.text: A few members lean over to make notes. It's powerful take out of context.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Nichols. You are aware that  Richard Kimble was the only  beneficiary of Helen Kimble's estate. 12 million dollars roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was aware of that. The money meant  nothing to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet in your presence, Richard Kimble  once said that 'if he had Helen's  money he could find plenty of uses.' Did he not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were talking about -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no? Nichols' look tells us everything... Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: On the stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wound to the head caused a  massive hemorrhage to the brain. It  took from five to seven minutes for  her to die... A woman in the jury reacts. Kimble notices.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: On the stand. He finishes his moving description of the  events. We see some of the jury has been moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And I was holding her when the  officers came in. Gutherie returns to his seat. The Prosecutor moves to the jury. He begins slowly but his questions pick up strength

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How tall was this man, Dr. Kimble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be sure. We were, mostly on  the floor, fighting... I couldn't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did that fight cause the scratches  on your face and arms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. As I explained -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how did this man enter your  house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you probably don't know why your  wife told the emergency operator You  were her attacker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name is Richard, isn't it? Your  gun is a .38, isn't it? Your prints  were on the gun, the bullets, the  lamp, her neck, weren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Kimble sits behind the desk, but already he's a  shadow of the man we knew before, stares ahead passively Judge Bennett delivers the sentencing to hushed courtroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After careful and studied review of  all evidence presented during each  phase of this proceeding, and  because aggravated circumstances,  detailed at length, were present  the night of January 20th. Kimble is silent, stunned, but all around him the sentenc shockwaves through the courtroom. Reporters push out rear doors. Prosecutors share a look - with a hangman's  satisfaction. Nichols, watching behind Kimble's table,  lowers his head. Disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD KIMBLE
dialogues.text: He remains silent. Kimble is pulled gently to his feet by bailiff. Gutherie whispers an "I'm sorry." Kimble doesn't hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Therefore, it is the decision of  this court... Looks over his shoulder to the emptying courtroom. Faces  stare back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Bennett's V.O. CONTINUES over: A locker opening. Inside, a profusion of chrome and nicke plating. Jailhouse jewelry. Handcuffs dragged out. Action checked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... that you be remanded to Menard  State penitentiary...

dialogues.speaker: CUFFS
dialogues.text: Slapped down over wrists, ratcheting down tight. Ankle cuffs dragged out. Pant legs raised, canvas shoes  exposed. Cuffs clamped down on ankles. CHAINS RATTLED out. Snaked across the floor. Looped aroun waists and locked to handcuffs to form belly chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... where you will serve a sentence  of life imprisonment without  possibility of parole.

dialogues.speaker: EXT . SALLY PORT, (COOK COW TY JAIL)
dialogues.text: The chain gang exits through the sally port. Kimble and  three other prisoners. Jailers escort them to... An Illinois Department of Corrections guard moves alongsi checking the undercarriage with a pole-mounted mirror. The GAVEL CRACKS as we -

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: Locking wire mesh cage inside bus. An old DIESEL COUGHS to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main gates open. The BUS GRINDS onto the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four prisoners sit scattered, still cuffed but no lon chained together. Near the front, PRISONER #1 is eyeing.. The two prison guards seated beyond the caged door. YOUNG GUARD lighting a smoke. OLD GUARD drowsing. Shotguns  bouncing on their knees. Prisoner #l shifts his gaze to.. The driver. Pistol on his hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUS RUMBLES north, heading towards the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRISONER #1 rises. Through caging:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Illinois penal regulations  require a meal for transport rides of four hours or more. Young Guard shakes his head. "Fucking jailhouse lawyers." Checks his watch: 4:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! Feedin' time. Old Guard yawns to his feet, unhooks a key-ring from his  belt. Young Guard stows his shotgun in the weapons locker PRISONER #2 looks at Kimble. Kimble stirs awake... watche the cage door open, Young Guard moving back. And across t aisle... PRISONER #3, a big man named COPELAND, wags his head  between his knees. Something slides out of his shirt and  CLANKS to the dimpled steel floor. It's a razor sharp  plastic shank. Heart quickening, Kimble looks forward. Young Guard is  handing a petrified sandwich to Prisoner #1. Kimble snaps a look back to Copeland, who palms the shank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe, and you're first. Old Guard watches from the open cage door, shotgun  carelessly ready. Young Guard reaches Kimble and extends a sandwich. Kimble doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. He offers the sandwich to Copeland. In the exchange,  sandwich drops. Copeland leans down for it. Up front, Old Guard yawns again just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! Too late... Jackknifing up, Copeland drives the shank int Young Guard's gut. Prisoner #2 dives for Young Guard's holster. As the gun c out, Young Guard gets a hand on it. A SHOT FIRES... Jolting Old Guard. He chambers his shotgun. Kimble hits t floor. The Old Guard jams a key into the cage door and su inside, but... Prisoner #1 broadsides Old Guard. SHOTGUN DISCHARGES...  Opening a big Gainsburger hole in the driver. He sinks un the steering wheel. A knee hits the accelerator. The CAGE DOOR SLAMS locked behind the Old Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the bus careens off the road, accelerating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Guard wrestles gun from Prisoner #2 and FIRES, kill prisoner #2. Copeland grapples with wounded Young Guard. Old Guard shotgun-butts Prisoner #1, flips the gun, PUMPS ONE ROUND into the man's chest. Dead. He turns just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the driverless BUS BUCKS ant BANGS over open ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Guard reloads. Copeland drops down behind a seat. Old Guard jams his SHOTGUN under the seat. But just as th Old Guard pulls the trigger the bus jerks. The SHOT goes  off target as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUS ROARS into a gravel embankment. ROARS up the slop and CRASHES down on its side - sliding to a stop at the  bottom of a small ravine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENGINE DIES. Dusty silence. We don't know up from down. On his knees, Old Guard makes his way to the driver. Find him dead. Now a SOUND. Old Guard whips his shotgun around at... Kimble. Rising between the seats. A hairy beat. Old Guard might kill him just to finish thi off. But a GROAN turns Old Guard's head. Young Guard, trying to hold his guts in. Old Guart turns find Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kimble)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. You're a doctor. C'mere. He slides to the Young Guard as the Old Guard scrounges u medical kit, shoves Kimble down on Young Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something. Kimble looks at his cuffs. "In these?" Old Guard digs out his key ring and unlocks Kimble's hands - only his hands. Kimble opens medical kit. It's been ransacked - just  Band-Aids now. Kimble looks into the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't going to make it unless he  gets to a hospital. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: ZL.
dialogues.text: In this delicate moment a SHIVER runs through the bus. Is just settling? With other things to worry about, Kimble tries to stop Yo Guard's bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: SEAT
dialogues.text: We see Copeland, alive. The crash has ripped the bars fro back window and shattered the glass. He works to get out opening.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO KIMBLE
dialogues.text: A second SHIVER ripples through the bus, stronger. Kimble retracts his hands to touch a metal panel - and feels a  growing vibration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just where the hell are we? The Old Guard feels it too. He gets down on his knees and looks out one of the shattered, barred windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus lies across railroad tracks. A not-too-distant be grows bright by the light of an approaching train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble sees: Old Guard fights the cage door. Kimble lunge to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's locked. Where're your keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downtrack, one Cyclops light appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble spots keys. Pitches them to Old Guard. Drags Young Guard to the front for a quick exit. But Old Guard fumble the key-ring, his hands shaking as much as the bus. The train light spider-webs across cracked windows. Kimbl snatches the keys away from the Guard's trembling hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one? This? This one?! Old Guard gulps a nod. Kimble jams a key in the lock. Thr the door open. Grabs Young Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me get him - But Old Guard climbs right over Kimble's back and climbs the shattered windshield.

dialogues.speaker: REAR OF BUS
dialogues.text: Copeland escapes through the hole in the back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and hits the ground running the other way. The  locomotive's headlight reveals the toppled bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Train light grows. A nanosecond of uncertainty: Should  Kimble leave the wounded man? Kimble and the Young Guard  hold a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the WHEELS BRAKE and LOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble struggles out of the bus - pulling the Young Guard behind him. He slings the man clear. SCREECHING death, the TRAIN SKIDS closer. For one heartbeat, Kimble remains perched atop the bus. The train light X-rays him. Kimble leaps. Lands. Rolls. Gains his feet. Tries to spri away but can't: His feet are still chained. He gets off a dozen mincing steps before... IMPACT: A hundred tons of STEEL SLAMS into the bus,  splitting it open. Shrapnel rips through Kimble's thigh, but he stays on his feet, still running feverish half-steps. An EXPLOSION envelops the train. Flames stream down its  flanks. The train burns past the wounded Guard. Kimble looks back, expecting to see the catastrophe behin him. But he gets the shock of his life - of any man's lif Still on its wheels, the locomotive is derailing - and co after him. It's the stuff of nightmares: One little man b chased by a fire-breathing locomotive. The train burrows to a stop. Kimble is suddenly five feet taller, standing on an uphea of earth, staring eyeball-to-eyeball with the train that  nearly devoured him. He pants. Coughs on smoke. Then noti something in his hand. It's the key-ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble sits and searches the key-ring for manacle key.  Suddenly a hand reaches down and snatches the key-ring aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that. Kimble watches as Copeland quickly unlocks both sets of h own chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You listen to me. I don't give a  damn which way you go, just don't  follow me. Kimble takes the key as Copeland wraps his chains around arm and runs. Kimble unlocks his leg irons and runs in th other direction - crossing a hilltop in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: News and sheriff's department choppers circle billowing  smoke. TILT DOWN to reveal the derailed train. Fire engin hose down the blackened locomotive. Rescue workers work  feverishly with jaws-of-life to get into the mangled  wreckage. Illuminated by spotlights, transportation  investigators in blue coveralls pick through the twisted  remains of the bus. State troopers restrain spectators. Two American-made rental cars pull up. Four deputy U.S.  marshals emerge: BIGGS. Swaggering Midwestern carnivore. Built like a bric shithouse. RENFRO. Bantam-rooster of a man, no more than 140 pounds  fully-equipped. POOLE. Black woman. Nobody minds having her around during nut-cuttin' time. NEWMAN, a scrub-faced G-5. From the second car steps GERARD. He takes in the media  spectacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good lord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this... a circus? As a group they begin moving along the service road above the crash site. Derailed train cars are accortianed below them. They take in the elements of the crash and as they  walk each begins to reveal their U.S. Marshal's credentia Biggs spots something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point of impact. ... and branches off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs, your turn to babysit Newman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. (to Newman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. They drop down to the crash site. Poole ant Renfro remain with Gerard. A state TROOPER steps into their path, but falls away whe sees Gerard's Marshall star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doing? Who's in charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Rollins. Just follow the  lights - Gerard follows his point to where TV lights illuminate th scene. He shakes his head - it doesn't please him. Renfro and Poole share a look, they seem to know what's  about to happen.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GUARD
dialogues.text: Seated near a tree. A space blanket draped over his  shoulders. He is surrounded by EMT personnel, and a YOUNG SHERIFF, clearly basking in the event. Television remote  news crews are kept only slight back. Gerard appears in t b.g., listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... train was bearin' down on us,  fast. I don't know how - it's still  kind of hazy - but I grabbed him and pushed him out of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coulda both been killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but hell, he's my partner. Woulda done the same for me. The young Sheriff in charge nods, buying the story. Gerar eases forward, displays his badge, interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Sheriff Rollins? Deputy  U.S. Marshal Samuel Gerard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be with you in a minute. The television lights widen to illuminate Gerard. He shie his eyes. The Sheriff opens a file and produces fax-photo of all four prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Old Guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the record. These three dead.  And this one... He switches to a photo of Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, everything happened so fast... (bites lip, decides)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh-uh. Don't think he made it. Sheriff eyes the wreckage that could entomb a hundred  prisoners, then files Kimble's fax-photo with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get some rest. He pats the Guard on the shoulder and approaches Gerard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you came a long way for  nothing. My men've already done a  thorough search from point of  impact and found nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CULVERT
dialogues.text: Biggs and Newman stop by the muddy culvert. Biggs sees  something. He orders Newman into the muck after it.

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: Aware of media, proceeds patiently with the young Sheriff

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, may I suggest  check-points starting at a 15-mile  radius on I-57, I-24, Route 13 east  of -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa... For what?  Prisoners are all dead. The only  thing check-points will do is get a  lot of good people out here frantic  and flood my office with calls. Gerard finally touches eyeballs with the young Sheriff an we get our first taste of Gerard at close range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shit, Sheriff, I'd hate for  that to happen... So, I'll be  taking over the investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On whose authority?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By authority of the Governor of the  State of Illinois and the office of the United States Marshal, 5th  District Northern Illinois... Poole produces State and Federal authorization documents  from one of her pockets and hands it to the young Sheriff

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back-down beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You want jurisdiction over  this mess, you got it. (to assistants)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it down. Wyatt Earp is here to mop up for us. He slaps the file of fax-photos at Gerard on his way out. Just as Biggs, spotless, eases ino the group with Kimble' manacles. Behind Biggs we see Newman, covered in mud. Seeing the leg irons, the Sheriff and his deputies pile t a stop. Now Gerard takes his run at Old Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, ladies and gentlemen, step back and give this poor man some  room. Like an obedient dog the press backs off, they sense a  change of story and command. Gerard kneels down with Poole and Renfro in front of the  Old Guard. The Sheriff hovers near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly, to Old  Guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always an interesting thing when we  find leg irons and no legs in them  who held the keys, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you be so kind as to show them to me, sir? Gerard's large hand extends palm up at the Old Guard. The Old Guard pats his pockets, comes up empty. He eyes t press hovering just out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second chance. Poole reopens the file of photos in front of the man. The Old Guard can't take it - points to Kimble's photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cracking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mighta got out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? A minute ago  you tell me he's part of the  wreckage, now you're -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renfro - Take that bus apart. I want  an accurate body count. Poole - Set  up operations right here. He stops and looks into the TV lights and starts moving  downtrack. The media and State Police move with him like  Israelites behind Moses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen... our  fugitive's been on the run for  ninety minutes. Average foot speed  over uneven ground - barring injury  is approximately four miles an hour,  giving us a radius of six miles. I  want a hard-target search of any  residence, gas station, farmhouse,  henhouse, doghouse and outhouse in  that area. Check-points go up at  15 miles. (to media)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that? Good. Now, turn  those damn things off and get out  of our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROARS... just above the treetops. Helicopter speeds up a dark river. Its tracking beam illuminates the river bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashing lights. Two highway patrol cars set up roadblock The SQUAWK of police RADIOS breaks the rural quiet. A mom later a HELICOPTER ROARS overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves down train tracks. His jumpsuit is wet with  blood from the gash. He pauses and checks the wound. He's going to need stitches. Far down the tracks he sees glow of town lights. He keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble crosses a tressel, keeps running toward the direct of the lights. A junk yard by railroad tracks and a road. Signs along th road show we're on the edge of town. One says: Hospital-1 mile.

dialogues.speaker: TRACKS AND STREAM
dialogues.text: Kimble runs from a streak up to the railroad tracks. As h nears the junk yard and road he sees the hospital sign.  He's close but he can't go into the hospital in his priso jumpsuit. He leans against a wrecked car and catches his  breath. Just then a tow truck pulling a car on its hook, turns of the road and parks next to the tracks. Kimble ducks for  cover behind the wrecked car. The driver climbs out, dumps his coveralls in the front  seat and closes the door. He moves toward a house across the tracks, then forgets  something and returns to the cab. He throws open the door and grabs lunch box off the seat - and we notice the  coveralls missing from the seat. As the driver returns to the house we MOVE TO the opposit side of the car to find Kimble, ducked beneath the window clutching the coveralls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crude headquarters is set up beneath a tent, near the  crash site. Maps are laid out on tables. Power and phone  lines are pulled down from the lines running along the  tracks. Renfro supervises the electronics. Poole handles phones, takes a report from the field and  relays it to Gerard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood trail found. Two miles  southwest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Biggs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Type it and match it against all  four prisoners. (to Renfro)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renfro, get an I.D. fax on Kimble to  every local hospital. (to Newman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newman... Newman appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some coffee. As Newman steps off, everyone turns at sound of SHOUTING  from the train crash.

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN CRASH
dialogues.text: A RESCUE WORKER shouts up to others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, one's alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loading dock outside the E.R. A WORKER stacks boxes of fo outside kitchen entrance. Kimble, in the tow truck  operator's coveralls, picks up a box and carries it insid Once inside he branches off down a hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens on a long hallway. A DOCTOR, CHILD with a  bandaged hand, and a MOTHER leave a room and walk TOWARD Behind them, Kimble moves down the hall and stops in fron of the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble closes the door and locks it. Hanging on the back the door we see a doctor's white coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Illinois State Trooper's car pulls up outside.

dialogues.speaker: CLOTH-COVERED INSTRUMENT TRAY
dialogues.text: On it we see: A packaged sterilized bandage, an opened  antiseptic wash, an opened topical anesthetic, and an emp syringe. We PULL BACK to find:

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: His wound bathed in orange antiseptic wash, three stitche already in. With pair of forceps he picks up the needle a he sutures himself.

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: At far end of the hall we see a STATE TROPER chatting wit DUTY NURSE at a nurses' station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble, his bandage already in place, gives himself a sho of antibiotics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man, tube in nose, on two I.V.s, lays in bed with eyes  closed. Kimble comes INTO FRAME near his face.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Can you hear me, sir? No response. The man is out of it. Kimble backtracks to t patient's closet and opens it. Hanging inside we see his  clothes. He removes them and notices the man's untouched  breakfast tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duty Nurse and State Trooper chat when a fax begins  coming through on DESK FAX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your fax...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble dressing in the man's clothes. He eats a piece of  toast - part of the man's breakfast - as he buttons up hi shirt.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT
dialogues.text: His arm slowly reaches out and presses his nurses call  button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fax photograph of Richard Kimble slowly comes off the  duty station FAX MACHINE. Next to the machine the  patient's call light comes on. The Duty Nurse, standing with the Highway Trooper, sees t patient's light come on and starts down the hall toward t patient's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble shaving when we hear the DUTY NURSE ENTER the  patient's room. He moves OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Patterson, do you need some more  water?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S EATEN BREAKFAST
dialogues.text: The Duty Nurse looks from the tray to the man, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Oh, you did a good job on this. She takes his empty plastic pitcher and... ... pushes open the bathroom door - no sign of Kimble - a refills the pitcher from the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder,  to patient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It does get dry in here, doesn't  it? She doesn't expect an answer, turns OFF the WATER, and go into the main room. As the door closes we see Kimble behi it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble, clean-shaven, and wearing the patient's glasses a a doctor's white coat, moves down the hall to the emergen room exit. Suddenly the State Trooper steps back from the E.R. admissions desk with his newly received fax, and sta down the corridor toward Kimble. The Trooper looks up as the two men pass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me, Doc?... Kimble turns but continues slowly backing toward the E.R. doors behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Don't know if you heard or not  but we're looking for an escaped  prisoner from that bus train wreck  'couple hours ago. Thought he might  show up here if he was hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he look like? The Trooper looks down at his fact sheet as we see a slow trickle of blood from a shaving nick begin winding down  Kimble's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from fax sheet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approximately six one, 180 pounds,  brown hair, brown eyes and beard. At the last second Kimble feels the drop of blood and wip it clean as the Trooper looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Seen anyone that fits that  description?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time I look in the mirror ... but without the beard. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Kimble moves through the E.R. doors as an ambulance parks outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two PARAMEDICS try to take out a patient on a gurney. The lead wheels are stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... Kimble helps clear the wheels so the collapsible gurney  comes free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Doc, we had to dig him out  from under a train. As the gurney comes out, Kimble looks right into the face of the Young Guard. The Guard's eyes suddenly open wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him... It's - Kimble claps the portable oxygen mask back over the Young Guard's mouth and keeps his hand there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he? The Paramedics move him toward the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pretty bad off. Broken leg,  ribs. Concussion. As Kimble moves away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the E.R. doctor he's also got  a perforated spleen. He's gone... The two Paramedics share a look as they whis the Young Guard inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, how could he tell that from  looking at his face?

dialogues.speaker: AMBULANCE
dialogues.text: Kimble climbs behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full communications link is in place. Deputy marshals answer phones, work faxes, add informatio to a situation board. Troopers bring in information. Pool calls Gerard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Background just came in from  Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit me. Renfro and Poole lay out the details. The download of  information comes clear and fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard David Kimble. Vascular  Surgeon. Convicted of first-degree  murder in the killing of his wife.  Pleaded innocent. Claimed a  one-armed -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not retry the case. Priors and accomplices? Gerard steps up the hillside out of sight of the  investigation to take a leak. Followed by Renfro and Pool

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None. No previous arrests. Poole takes up a position discreetly behind tree as Gerar unzips his fly and relieves himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sealed juvie record? Poole calls out from behind tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Total cherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relatives? Children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No relatives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One child. A son. Died in drowning  accident three years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl friends? Ex-wives? Friends?  Combinations of the above?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lot of friends. Doctors. Hospital  staff. Gerard zips up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start there. Authorize taps. Cover his lawyer first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet me. Renfro won't take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have Stevens go to Judge Rubin,  he'll sign 'em. ... Biggs charges up the hillside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeLange Hospital. Wounded guard  swears to High Holy he saw Kimble  right there in the hallway.  Ambulance, missing too.

dialogues.speaker: SITUATION TENT
dialogues.text: Gerard moves quickly to the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O-nine-thirty. Twenty minutes ago. Gerard redraws the circle of units. No longer are we  covering a fifty-mile radius. The circle is redrawn,  tightened, with the hospital as its center. The  triangulation is set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance follows three cars toward a rural railroad  crossing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... We're waiting up here in Canton. Wondering if you heard anything on  this Kimble chase -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble behind the wheel as he approaches the railroad  crossing. The biocom monitors police chatter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-twelve-A, be advised that all  discussion on this matter is to be  conducted on a tactical frequency  - either Channel K or Z. Over. Frequency goes dead. Kimble looks THROUGH the windshield:

dialogues.speaker: ROAD SIGN
dialogues.text: An arrow points toward Canton, two miles. The cars in front slow as the railroad crossing signal  suddenly activates and the bars begin to drop. Kimble pop the SIREN and hurriedly snakes through the crossing and  heads in the opposite direction... but his maneuver gets  attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truck driver watches Kimble cut through the crossing and  reaches for his C.B. radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poole hangs up phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulance just spotted two miles  west of Doverville. Heading north  on State road 53. Renfro turns to the map and marks it. The circle is much  smaller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running outta map, Sam. The crash site and hospital are already marked. Gerard is ready to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the way we want it. Okay,  people, let's button up. They move off to waiting State Trooper cars and helicopte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble driving down a rural road. He flips down visor and eyeballs folded roadmap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The ambulance crests a hill. In the distance we see t Grosvner Viaduct and the Barkley Dam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blowing other traffic off the road, WHOOPING CRUISERS and G-cars stream south through the rugged rural terrain of  Southern Illinois. Overtaking them all, a CHOPPER THUNDER overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading into hilly terrain. Down below we see the ambulan Inside the helicopter Gerard eyes the terrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a visual... (to Gerard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's heading toward the viaduct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seal it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two-lane road disappears into long tunnel. Three hund feet below the road tumbles the Tennessee River. The Barkley Dam rises ahead. Kimble's AMBULANCE ROARS int the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: ON KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Suddenly sees the helicopter setting down ahead of him at the mouth of the tunnel. Kimble slams on brakes and turns to retreat.

dialogues.speaker: FAR END OF TUNNEL, (BEHIND HIM)
dialogues.text: Illinois Highway Patrol cars pull to a stop at the far  entrance. Light flares. Set out road blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard steps out followed by Renfro and Poole.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE'S AMBULANCE
dialogues.text: Comes to a stop, blocking traffic in both directions.  Immediately HORNS begin BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trooper pulls up. Biggs and Newman behind Kimble blocking the other end. Troopers with guns drawn block the exits. The P.A. from a State patrol car blares:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please remain in your vehicles and  lock your doors. Repeat, please  remain in -

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Poole and Renfro materialize already decked out in Kevlar They're jacked up and ready to rock. Renfro hands Gerard vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got him. Gerard unholsters a 40 caliber, Glock model 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, ladies and gentlemen hard  part's over. He starts into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're movin' in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weapons drawn, but held discreetly at their sides, three  silhouettes enter. Drivers who hadn't heeded the Troopers P.A. warnings take one look at Gerard and quickly climb  back inside and lock their doors. Biggs, Renfro and Poole fan out to the sides and give the middle to Gerard. The tunnel is quickly quiet. Kimble huddles at mid-tunnel. He's trapped. Drops to the  ground beneath the truck. His heart pounding, brain  clicking, fighting panic. Suddenly he realizes he's in wa Running water.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARSHALS
dialogues.text: They reach the mid-tunnel area. No Kimble. Biggs looks  around, beneath vehicles. Gerard listens. Poole looks  confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd he go? Gerard spots the trickle of water. He backtracks it until he finds a loose grate in the pavement. Man-size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs, Renfro with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble splashes blindly through ankle-deep sluice. He slo at forking tunnels to catch his breath and pick a directi A DULL ROAR comes from somewhere - from everywhere. He wh off his jacket and slings it down a tunnel, then continue straight ahead. Somewhere behind, lights probe splash-patterns on the con wall - telltale signs of Kimble's passing. The lights bel to... Gerard, Biggs and Renfro. They push on, soon reaching the forking tunnels. Renfro finds the jacket ant splash signs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Channel Three. They conform their radios. Splitting up, Biggs and Renfro left. Gerard - straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble. Bracing with all four limbs. Negotiating a mossy  downslope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs and Renfro. Sweeping his light as he advances.  Searching for splash-patterns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into shoulder-mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard. Probing a branch-off tunnel with his light. About pass, he notices scrapings on the mossy walls of the  branch-off tunnel. Hand marks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a possible here. Stand by. He stows his light but hangs onto the Glock. Bracing with three limbs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard begins the tricky descent. Slips once. Recovers.  Slips again... ... and tumbles out of control. GUN and RADIO CLATTER AWA Scrabbling for purchase, he finally snags An overhead pip Gerard stabilizes. Sweeps his light to locate his Glock,  lying down-tunnel. He eases toward it. But another hand g there first. It's Kimble. Face dark and desperate. Dangerous. Hand  flexing on the pistol. They lock eyes for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you didn't kill your wife. Not my problem. An adrenal beat. For a moment they hold a look. Then the  silence is broken by Gerard's radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard? You there? Gerard looks for his radio, then back at Kimble - he's go Instantly Gerard reaches for his ankle - and pulls a back piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Renfro hears FOOTSTEPS POUNDING his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard charges down the tunnel. From a side tunnel, Renfr appears, almost colliding. Biggs follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight ahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble sticks Gerard's gun into his waist band to balance in the tunnel. He spills around a corner and stops. Ahead lies an orb of light. The tunnel ends. The NOISE is  incredible. Kimble moves to the end of the tunnel and  stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water pours from the tunnel into the spillway of Barkley disappearing into a veil of mist below - a great cauldron mists. No rocks. None visible at least. He hears the MARSHALS behind him - COMING CLOSER.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALS
dialogues.text: Gerard and Renfro turn the corner. Renfro drops into a  shooting stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around, hands over your head.  And get down on the ground. For a moment Kimble eyes Gerard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your choice, Kimble... Kimble turns his back on the Marshals, stares again at th water. Slowly he puts his hands over his head. Gerard put up his gun and pulls his handcuffs. He moves through the  water toward Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down on your knees. Kimble bends slowly, stares down into the falls, hears th footsteps get closer, then does the unthinkable. He jumps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs moving to the top of the massive dam sees Kimble le into the sheet of water spilling over dam and disappear i the mists below. He can't believe his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renfro lowers his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch... It's the most amazing thing he's ever seen...

dialogues.speaker: ON GERARD
dialogues.text: He stands at the mouth of the tunnel staring down. He  stares down into the mists. Impressed. It has told him  something invaluable about this fugitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard scrambles out of the tunnels to the top of the dam near Biggs, just as squad cars, troopers and the search  helicopter converge on the site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far downriver a figure fights through a snag in the bend. The snag - a tree branch - breaks away and heads down  stream. Hanging onto the branch we see Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below the dam and spillway. Troopers in waders search the shallows, deputies beat bushes along the shore. Farther out we see a dredge boat slowly working the water

dialogues.speaker: FROM SHORE
dialogues.text: Gerard watches the dredge cage come up again. As if with  the next pass it will prove him the victor. The HEAD  ILLINOIS TROOPER CAPTAIN approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running out of daylight, Inspector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights and generators are coming,  Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't mean to tell you your  job, but maybe one person in a  million could've survived that fall. The guy's fish food. Gerard turns and brings his look to bear on the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then find me the fish that ate him. He turns and heads to a waiting helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble runs through the woods. He staggers, his arm hooks sapling which spins him to the ground. He lays motionless exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen in bed. Kimble's hand comes INTO FRAME and touches  her shoulder. She turns toward Kimble as he moves INTO  FRAME and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen tosses her head back. She wears white silk pajamas  and smiles down AT us. A hand reaches up and unbuttons th top two buttons of her top. Then Kimble moves up INTO FRA as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen running down beach TOWARD us. Embraces Kimble as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen's head comes up out of a pool. Hair tossed back, sh smiles as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen exiting Kimble's car the night of the murder. She  looks back at Kimble, framed by the door frame, ant smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye. I love you. Again... Then again... then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble comes out of his sleep with a start. Shivering. He remembers where he is. His breathing returns to normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves across a river trestle and disappears into  tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble on pay phone in the rear of the store waits for  party  to answer. An old lady and her mother shop. Across the store a pharmacist watches Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE
dialogues.text: Kimbles watches the boys as he waits for answer. We hear  RINGING, then a receptionist answers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The law offices of Gutherie, Morgan  and Wainwright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Gutherie please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Gutherie has left  for the day, would you like his  voice mail? Kimble hangs up and moves down an aisle, stopping in fron of the hair color. He takes a box of black hair dye off t shelf and looks at the instructions. When he looks up he  sees the pharmacist looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A roadside diner. Kimble, his hair now black, and wearing new pair of Wranglers, hooded sweatshirt and a duffle coa moves down the road to the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble enters. He sits at the counter and a sparky OLDER  WAITRESS, late, mid-forties, with strong good looks and  tough smile fills his coffee cup before he even asks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need to look at the menu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some soup, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good choice. She marks her pad and leaves. Sights ant sounds around  Kimble begins to occupy his attention: A dishwasher buses a tub of dishes back to the kitchen. H stares at him. A farmer sitting at a table stares at Kimble, Kimble look away. A man at the pay phone seems to be staring at him. he calling the police? Everyone seems to be looking at hi Someone stops in front of him. A young waitress serves hi his soup. Where's the first waitress? Takes a few sips of soup. Out of the corner of his eye he sees: The Older Waitress putting on her coat to leave. Is she  going to report him? He fights the paranoia. A NEWS REPORT on the TELEVISION gets his attention.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: A report on the escape. A television reporter describes t chase for Kimble; his jump at the dam and his presumed de from the fall. Kimble decides it's time to leave. He drops some money on the counter and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves across the parking lot trying not to run unt he's out of sight of the diner. Once free of the lights o the diner he starts running and disappears into the night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble running down the road. Fields stretch out on both  sides of the highway. Open land. From behind him we sudde hear the sound of POLICE SIRENS. For a moment Kimble move faster, then as the SIRENS COME CLOSER, his sprint drops a jog... to a walk, until finally he stops and waits for inevitable... But the flashing lights suddenly rip past h chasing a speeder. They weren't after him after all. Kimb looks at himself. He's shaking. A moment later he is lit by headlights. A car pulls up ne to him, passenger window rolls down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a ride? Kimble stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way are you going? She smiles and points in the direction her car is traveli They hold a look as we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We feel confident about the I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet house on a quiet street out from town. A homeless woman picks through garbage. A garbage truck moves slowly down the street. A plumbing truck parked along a curb. Ju early morning traffic. We see Renfro and Newman watch the house from across the  street, behind a deserted house. Gerard joins them. We se that Biggs is in the plumbing truck. Poole is the homeles woman picking through the garbage. Newman hands Gerard a  radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Local officials were about to wet  their pants to move in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet they were. (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the woman?

dialogues.speaker: BIGGS
dialogues.text: In the plumbing truck. He triggers his mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I'll take front. Biggs and  Renfro, rear. Poole, handle support.  I don't want anyone hurt. Stay  outside unless called. Radios on  three. The deputies prepare their weapons. Newman checks his  service issue .38, stares at Gerard's Glock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, just want me to wait here, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, no. You're with me, Newman.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOOR CRASHES open, splintering the deadbolt right out of  the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U.S. Marshals. Down! Down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Textbook perfect, Gerard and Newman rush into front room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the hall a man's figure streaks across a doorway OUT OF VIEW. A woman in the rear of the house BEGINS SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: Motions Newman to the left to check the door off the livi room while he moves down the main hall into the back  bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM / NEWMAN
dialogues.text: Clearly unnerved by the screaming woman, Newman opens doo off the living room. The door opens into a smaller bedroo He steps into -

dialogues.speaker: SMALLER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: It's empty. Gerard appears at the other (hallway) door to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Gerard motions Newman on to the door to the bathroom and  continues down the hall into the back bedroom where the  woman continues SCREAMING. He ignores her. His feet move  silently, heel-to-toe. He checks the bathroom as Newman  opens his connecting door - empty - then moves on toward  the doorway to the kitchen. Gerard moves to the kitchen doorway. Running out of house He braces himself swings into the kitchen - it too is emp Suddenly Gerard gets the bad feeling he's passed his prey

dialogues.speaker: SMALLER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Newman looks around, suddenly scared. The only place he  didn't search was behind the bedroom door. He turns just

dialogues.speaker: COPELAND
dialogues.text: Surges out, knocks Newman's gun from his hand. In a flash Copeland yanks Newman's arm behind his back and presses a knife against the deputy's neck and moves him out of the  room. We...

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: He hears Copeland moving somewhere in the front of the ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your man! Now I want outta  here! Gerard moves back through the bedroom past the SCREAMING  woman. He locks in on the voice and sound of the moving  fugitive.

dialogues.speaker: ON COPELAND AND NEWMAN
dialogues.text: Copeland listens but gets no response from Gerard. He bac through the second bedroom door, pulling Newman into the

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Newman's eyes are pure terror - the blade pressed against his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gerard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me? I said, I want out or  I'll cut your man's throat!

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: Keeps moving down the hallway, through first bedroom, pau at door to the second bedroom and chooses his course.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Copeland positions himself between the bedroom door and t hallway opening. He's troubled he can't hear Gerard. Suddenly he hears a NOISE behind him at the bedroom door whips Newman around and we see: A shoe hits the floor. Copeland realizes his mistake too  late. He turns back to the hallway and there is Gerard. He never blinks. FIRES once killing Copeland instantly.  The knife falls to the floor. Newman clutches his head,  stunned but unhurt. Gerard now turns to the screaming woman behind him in the bedroom doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. She does. Immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As coroners and tactical police mop up. Gerard moves acro the yard, sips coffee from Styrofoam cup. He stops at a  sheriff's car, Newman sits on back seat, shaken, nearly  hysterical, clutching his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ear... I can't hear a thing out  of it. I can't believe you did that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I should have bargained  with him, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You could've missed! You  could've killed me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're absolutely right. I  could've. They hold a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad's your ear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrible. I probably have permanent  hearing damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see it. Newman leans toward him. Gerard speaks into his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't bargain. Gerard leaves. Newman watches him - realizing what a trul unsettling man Gerard is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble makes call. While he waits for phone to be answere TRAINS COME and GO in the b.g. An EL CROSSES OVERHEAD. Th BELLS of Chicago River DRAWBRIDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter. It's Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Gutherie answers phone from his office overlooking Lake Michigan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard... Jesus, why did you run?  Running only makes you look guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't worrying about appearances,  Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me where you are. I'll come meet you so you can turn yourself  in .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not turning myself in. I need  money. Gutherie is silent. When he speaks again his speech takes the lawyerly tone of a man who's covering his own bases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard. You're asking me to harbor and aid a convicted felon... I can't help you that way. My advice - both  as a friend and as your legal counsel  - is for you to give yourself up.  Now tell me... where are you? Kimble picks up the change in his attorney's tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: St. Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me an address. I'll be - CLICK. Gutherie hears the LINE GO DEAD. Kimble's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
