dialogues.text: Kimble stands in the doorway with cup of coffee. He consi his next move. Then seeing bank clock flash the time: 9:3 he knows what that move is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An upscale mid-town tennis club. Behind glass windows of  the entryway we see tennis courts. From the courts comes Charles Nichols still dressed in his warmups, carrying hi tennis bag. A friendly DESK ATTENDANT Sharon) smiles as h goes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow, Dr. Nichols?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creature of habit, Sharon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Nichols leaves the club. He tosses his gym bag into t back of his car and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he pulls up to the first stoplight, a homeless man mov toward the driver's side and begins washing his windshiel Nichols waves the man off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today, please. The man shuffles off. Just then a second man appears at h passenger window. He leans down to wave him away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not - ... then stops - the face at his passenger window is  Richard Kimble's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God... Richard... Nichols rolls down the passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you doing, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some money. Whatever you've  got on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nichols reaches into his gym bag in the backseat and digs for his wallet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me where you're staying. I'll  get you more money. Some clothes.  Just give me an address...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you. Kimble glances around, the area is still clear. He looks  back into the car and doesn't see the police car turn the corner and come up the street behind them. Nichols finds his wallet ant hands all the cash he's got Kimble, who quickly pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know why you came back - to find  him. If I can help, call me...  Call me. They hold a look. The stoplight changes to green but they don't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Charlie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Richard, take my coat... He reaches into the back for his coat, suddenly police ca behind him POPS its SIREN. Nichols looks into his rearvie mirror. Sees a COP lean out his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nichols)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy - green light. Let's go. Nichols looks back at Kimble. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIO TA
dialogues.text: REWINDING. The media room - just what it sounds like - banks of audio/video equipment and a sound board. Renfro rewinds the tape. Gerard, Biggs, Poole and Newman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've alerted St. Louis P.D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call them back. Tell them you've  made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Renfro)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it there. Renfro hits play. Kimble's VOICE is heard again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the voices. Renfro removes the two voices. What comes up are the

dialogues.speaker: BACKGROUND SOUNDS. EXTERIOR NOISES
dialogues.text: MECHANICAL... TRAINS). Everyone becomes focused to the  sounds now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's heard something)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trains? Traffic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More... there's a voice in the  background. At first the sound is unrecognizable. A BELL. GRINDING  MECHANICAL. Then a P.A. VOICE on the tape: "Next stop  Merchandise Mart."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an El announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's no E1 in St. Louis.  Ladies and gentlemen, Richard Kimble is in Chicago. Poole, get his  artwork out to local police and have  C.P.D. check the shelters... Biggs,  bring in the detectives that handled  his case. Instantly the room is in movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll prepare the press release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Stevens stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know he's alive and as  far as Kimble knows we don't either.  I want to keep it that way as long  as we can. Are we clear? The whole group sense Gerard's intensity in regard to  Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for the group)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfectly. Gerard reflects on a moment of personal satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noah... go to my office and let's  officially take Dr. Kimble out of  purgatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning roll call. Kimble's photo distributed to cops by  Detectives Kelly and Rosetti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As of this morning Chicago P.D. was  alerted to the reappearance of  Richard Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newman and Poole check train station. Looking for Kimble. They show his photo to homeless people. No help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding a handkerchief to his face, Kimble moves through  arriving patients and enters Cook County Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renfro and Biggs check shelters for Kimble. They show his I.D. to administrator. Look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is humming now. Detectives Kelly and Rosetti si in front of Gerard. Gerard studies Kimble's file. Renfro  sits in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police units have also increased  patrols around homeless shelters and mass transit stations in the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police patrol the platform looking for Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves past security, then pockets the handkerchief turns up a hallway, blending in with the indigents and po

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NURSE FLYNN, a woman about 45, attractive, smart, loyal. Poole and Gerard talk to her in an examination room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran his office for twelve years.  Yes, we were very close. But he  wouldn't come to me for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy with doctors, orderlies and street people. Kimble mo down hallway and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves into the room and takes a new patient form, look around. SEE BACK INTO the office area of the clinic. It  could be any hospital clinic from this view. But as Kimble turns to leave we see a PATIENT waiting to called. On his lap we see a prosthetic arm. Kimble looks from the arm to the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. As he turns to leave we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't underestimate this guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Roberts from the party, talks to Biggs and Gerard as takes off scrubs to get into shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.K.'s one smart, cold sonofabitch... He did her, no question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves down the hallway containing the janitor's  locker room. Janitors move in and out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard walks through Kimble's house. The art and most of  the furniture is gone. Books are in boxes and shopping  bags around the room. Plastic covers the remaining pieces of furniture. Gerard stares at the empty walls. Shadows on the walls sh where the art once hung. Gerard pauses, tries to absorb t place. He takes a book from one of the bags and looks at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves past the lockers, racks and boxes of cleanin supplies, stops at a board listing work schedules, vacati leaves, locker numbers. Behind him a LOCKER SLAMS. As a  janitor moves off to the showers we see his locker did no close but remains slightly ajar from the impact.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKER
dialogues.text: Door opens revealing the janitor's clip on I.D. hanging  from a green shirt. Kimble steals it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard looks at the two detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I appreciate the  cooperation of the Chicago police... He moves toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SALESMAN stands on ladder looking through pants sizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say, 38/34?

dialogues.speaker: SALES COUNTER
dialogues.text: WHAP. A folded pair of green janitor's pants drops onto t counter in front of Kimble. He already has the green shir to the uniform.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Photographed.

dialogues.speaker: SIDE OF THE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Kimble takes the finished photos from the delivery tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there anything in your initial  investigation that would make you  think Kimble would come back to  Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man definitely has friends here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about lady friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that we found.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT NOTICE
dialogues.text: A card on a community bulletin board advertises a basemen apartment for rent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the man he claimed  attacked his wife? Kimble pulls the notice from the board as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly and Rossetti share a look, a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... You ever been downwind of a  stockyard when the breeze is  blowing? That's where we were  sitting when Richard Kimble told that one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble knocks at door. It is opened to reveal a PUNK KID, 18-20. He calls to someone O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light comes on and an OLD POLISH WOMAN, her stockings  rolled down her shins, leads the way down the basement  stairs. The Punk Kid stands at the top of the stairs,  watches Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found nothing. The Polish woman shows him a spare but sufficient bed and nightstand set up. She points to door leading up to the  street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble also at work at the bedside table. He carefully cu out his do-it-yourself photograph and places it over the  existing photograph on the hospital I.D. The name on the  I.D. says: Desmondo Jose Ruiz. Then he places a thin piec of lamination plastic and trims the edges. Kimble defaces the plastic to give it rough look, then  examines the finished product not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this guy existed believe me  someone would've found him.

dialogues.speaker: ON GERARD
dialogues.text: He raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: FRAMED PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: Of medical residents. Two photographs next to each other. young Richard Kimble and Charles Nichols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Kimble... I saw him two  days ago. WE PULL BACK to see: Gerard studying the photos. Renfro  looks up like someone's bitten him. He, Biggs and Gerard in Nichols' administrative office. Gleaming. Filled with  awards and photos of Nichols and influential people. Nich hangs up his lab coat and slips back into his suitcoat. H shows no sign of nervousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stopped me in my car. I gave him  some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside our tennis - (correcting himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - my tennis club. Gerard moves around Nichols' office taking in the details

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he ask you for help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I volunteered. He wouldn't accept  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think he came back to  Chicago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask you that, sir. I'm sure he was trying to protect you from  having to lie for him. Gerard continues to move around the room, study prints,  books, drawings, awards and photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're really his friend, you'll  help us bring him in unharmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, so he can go back to prison?  If you want help, gentlemen, you've  come to the wrong man. Gerard finds a photo of Nichols and a gleaming Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Nichols, last year the U.S.  Marshals' office closed out 11,003  warrants... 10,975 of those were  captured. The twenty-eight others  thought they were smarter than  us... Now they're dead. (re: the photo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice car. Gerard puts the photo down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard and his deputies leave Nichols' outer office.  Gerard clearly feels he's come to the right man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble mopping the trauma room hallway. The hallway elbow around a corner and Kimble stands less than ten feet from a door that is marked: "PROSTHETIC CLINIC" He watches a technician leave the clinic and mops closer the doorway, and fails to see an attractive WOMAN DOCTOR  with white coat and stethoscope draped around her neck tu the corner behind him ant step on the freshly mopped  section. Head down, she is completely absorbed in a file and doesn see the wet floor until she slips slightly, looks up but  keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Rudy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said he's sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't they tell you to put up the  sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh. No they didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put up the 'wet floor' sign before  someone gets hurt. She keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole. She looks back at Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Anne keeps moving off toward trauma hall. He watches her  turn the corner to the trauma hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble enters the dimly lit prosthetics lab. He moves silently among the casts and prosthetics of arms hands, legs hanging from the ceiling. Cables and electron equipment are on the counters. He leaves the lab and moves into the office section of th Prosthetic Clinic. He passes a computer room and finally  reaches the office. He is about to enter when a woman's  voice stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ricky... Weren't you just in  here? Kimble turns to see a PROSTHETIC TECHNICIAN. A large woma with glasses. She stands with a partially finished  prosthetic arm.

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY HIT
dialogues.text: The one-armed man's arm coming off in the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I thought you were Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stumbling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I've got to clean the blinds in the office. Want me to wait till  you're finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw... I'm going to be here all  night. You won't bother me. She slips on a pair of headphones and goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble cleaning the blinds, keeps an eye on the Technicia who is listening to music on her Walkman. She is carefull painting a section of the arm. Not watching Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: FILE DRAWER
dialogues.text: Opened.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Nimble looks over his shoulder. The Technician doesn't se him. A Prosthetic Clinic Operations Manual is removed from she Photographs of prosthetic arms. Kimble shifts the materia into his clothes, closes his coat and suddenly he stops.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Kimble waits for the elevator. The folders in his uniform shift and he tries to rearrange them. When he turns back  we see Anne Eastman beside him. Her I.D. says:  "ANNE EASTMAN". She sees him doing the rearranging. The elevator arrives. They step into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne moves to the back. Kimble on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find that sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called me an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I was having a bad  shift. They laugh. They reach ground level and step out together

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worked at other hospitals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of them over the years. Here,  long ago. Hasn't changed much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet it hasn't. See you. They part ways. Kimble continues out the door. Anne stops and watches him leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble sits on the night train going home. He begins look at his information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afternoon light comes in Kimble's basement windows. Sheet of Prosthetic Clinic patient material are spread over  Kimble's bed, floor. Kimble searches through the document making notes. He studies photos of attachments. Cable  attachments. Joints. Electronics. Pins. straps... looking for a key to the identity of the one-armed man. Finally he stops. He finds the flyer in his pocket, puts on the bedside table and moves to sink. He wets a towel a covers his face. Draws a cool damp breath. Lays back on bed amid the  Prosthetic Clinic material.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Kimble pulls the arm. It separates in the one-armed man's sleeve. Wrenches. Dis-articulates.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Reacts in pain. Again. (NOTE: We sense Kimble's mind  returning to something. Getting closer to the key...)

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Escaping the bedroom. We hear his FOOTSTEPS DOWN the  STAIRS... a DOOR SLAM. FOOTSTEPS again. Another DOOR SLAMS, but this time the sound is distinctly different... a CAR DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble yanks the wet rag from his face, his senses alert. Listening, he hears: FOOTSTEPS are real, just outside and MOVING TOWARD him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car door slams. We see unmarked police cars pulling up front of the apartment. Cops are moving toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble turns off his light, moves from the bed to the win Carefully looks out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unmarked police cars in front of the house, looking, movi his way.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kimble moves instinctively to the back door. He starts to open it but through the dirty window, he see the back courtyard covered by more cops. Kimble moves back toward the front. Unsure of his next mo he's sweating, preparing for the worst. He watches the TAC team charge the house but instead of  charging through the basement door they move up the front steps and into the house overhead. Overhead he hears the SCREAMING from the arresting cops.

dialogues.speaker: BACK STEPS
dialogues.text: Kimble SEES the Punk Kid try to escape out the back. He  runs, sees cops and runs toward Kimble's basement door,  actually reaching it before he is caught by the cops and pulled away.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Moves toward the front window and watches cops lead the  Punk Kid out to the car. POLICE RADIOS call the other cops to stand down. Kimble moves slowly to his front door. Looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops put the young man into an unmarked police car. His  grandmother, the Polish woman, follows them, crying.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kimble leans against the wall, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble carries his cleaning tray down busy hallway just  outside of the Prosthetic Clinic and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cops talk outside the Prosthetic Clinic.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kimble backs to a safe place in the trauma hallway to wai for them to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Punk Kid is handcuffed to a bench as a cop works on a report. Suddenly the Kid notices something that gets his  attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wanted poster of Kimble over the cop's head.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The Kid sees - Wanted for Murder - realizes who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey! I know that guy! The cop looks up, sees Kimble's poster and then back at t Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves toward prosthetic clinic. In passing through the trauma hallway he becomes aware of a crisis developin A major accident has happened, victims are being brought The P.A. CALLS for doctors. STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: FAR END OF TRAUMA HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Elevator doors open as orderlies bring in new patients.  Some walk, some are helped by family and police. Nurses  direct traffic. Orders fly. Medicines are called. Family members yell for doctors. Ask for the injured. Anne picks up the pace with an ORDERLY wheeling a gurney carrying a young patient,  a BOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus flipped off the overpass. Got at least twenty more coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this one here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fractured sternum. X-ray's coming  up. Anne checks the boy's chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we've got to get some room in this hallway, people. Orderlies quickly move the non-life-threatening patients of the hall. Still more help is needed. Anne spots Kimble

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, take this one up the hall to Critical Care. Kimble nods. Anne moves to another patient. Kimble grabs the kid's gurney and begins wheeling it up t hall. As he pushes he looks at the kid's X-rays. Anne looks up, barks another order, then suddenly sees Ki pushing the gurney and looking at the film.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Tries to negotiate through the incoming patients to get a better look, but Kimble is gone. She goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: ON KIMBLE
dialogues.text: He wheels the Boy's gurney into an elevator. The doors  close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble wheels the gurney down the hall and stops the Boy  on the scrub threshold to the O.R. and stops a SURGEON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey! A Surgeon pauses and eyes Kimble's janitor suit and the  gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just sent this one up. He takes a look at the Boy's chart and grabs the X-rays a yells to O.R. nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob! Get this one into room four,  stat. He looks up, Kimble is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble enters the Prosthetic Clinic computer room. The  Technician from the day before is listening to her Walkma sees Kimble and waves. Kimble waves back and turns into t glass-walled computer room and closes the door. He closes the blinds and turns on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crisis has wound down. Anne moves into the room and  begins checking patients. She stops a unit nurse, GLADYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys, where's the boy I sent down  with the janitor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one with the fractured sternum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never came in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble scans DOS files, each an eight-letter enigma. Find one with promise and loads it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong... He backs up and tries another file.

dialogues.speaker: LIMB, OR OTHER
dialogues.text: Kimble knows he's got it.

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN
dialogues.text: Kimble keys in these responses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne comes out of the stairwell and stops the Surgeon we  saw with Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, did you see a janitor come up  here earlier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he brought a kid up. (handing her the chart)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne, did you write the orders? I  couldn't make out the signature...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a hurry now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever did knew what the hell he  was doing. Kid's a hair away from  a ruptured aorta. He heads to the operating room, leaving her stunned. She  stares at the scrawled orders.

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN
dialogues.text: A "PLEASE WAIT" message appears on the screen. We hear th COMPUTER PROCESSING, searching, narrowing. The screen flashes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy-five. Hell, yes. Kimble types in another defining characteristic...  Residence: Illinois. Again he waits. Rattles the blinds to make it seem like h cleaning. The list shortens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY HIT
dialogues.text: Prosecutor stands before the jury.

dialogues.speaker: PROSECUTOR
dialogues.text: ... murdering Helen Wills Kimble the night of January 20.

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN
dialogues.text: Kimble types in: "Candidates having adjustment appointmen between January 21, and February 1, 1993." Kimble waits. Sixty-five names come up. Again too many.  Kimble's reached a dead end. Kimble thinks.

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY HIT
dialogues.text: The fight with the One-Armed Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something has clicked in his memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble stands beneath the hanging artificial limbs. He  takes down an arm, works the joint.

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY HIT
dialogues.text: Kimble fights the One-Armed Man. He wrenches the man's  prosthetic arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves it again. Harder, at an awkward angle.

dialogues.speaker: ARM
dialogues.text: Kimble wrenches the arm...

dialogues.speaker: ARM
dialogues.text: The joint strains.

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY HIT
dialogues.text: Kimble wrenches it and it BREAKS.

dialogues.speaker: PROSTHETIC MANUAL
dialogues.text: A detailed diagram of arm construction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble makes notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne rides the elevator back to trauma. She's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: Joint repair list between January 21-April 21... Five nam come up with Greater Chicago addresses. Kimble hits print. The MACHINE begins PRINTING. Kimble  looks up at the Prosthetic Clinic Technician - she is  listening to her headphones, can't hear the printer. He  continues to shake the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble leaves Prosthetic Clinic and starts down the hall  for the exit when a voice stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a particular interest in our patients' x-rays? Kimble turns to see Anne coming toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you looking at that boy's  chest film. She moves in on him. He eyes the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hobby of mine -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What other hobbies do you have?  Brain surgery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? She reaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know how that kid ended  up in surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a janitor. I did what I was  told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Who changed those orders? They hold a look. She knows. He takes a step back and she pulls his I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stand right here. I'm calling  security. Kimble runs. Anne turns to call security but doesn't. She stares after Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble's room being searched by the marshals. Gerard find the flyer Kimble was handed on his way out the door. On i we see: COOK COUNTY HOSPITAL.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE'S I.D.
dialogues.text: Anne and Gerard stand in the hallway. Gerard studies the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man posing as a janitor orders an  emergency operation and all you do  is pull his I.D.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little boy's alive today because  he did something. Gerard watches her eyes carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you weren't aware that when he  escaped he was being transported to  Menard State Prison to begin a term  of life imprisonment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For murdering his wife. Clearly this is news to Anne. Gerard almost smiles at her surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your help, Doctor. He moves to the position Anne saw Kimble with the kid's  gurney. Trying to imagine what Kimble was doing at that  place. Renfro and the other deputies converge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I can't figure is, if you were  Kimble, why'd you take a major  league chance of hanging around a  trauma ward? Gerard considers this as a Man passes him. Gerard notices something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place would be crawling with cops. Slowly Gerard separates from the group of deputies and  follows the Man down the hall. The Man Gerard is following turns the corner to the  Prosthetic hallway and realizing Gerard is following him, holds the hallway door open for Gerard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you find something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir, I think you already  have. We see the Man has a prosthetic arm and that they are out the door marked: "PROSTHETIC CLINIC"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restaurant deserted at this hour. Kimble makes calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... This is Dr. Elway at Cook  County. I'm doing follow-up work for  the Prosthetic Clinic on Matthew  Zelick... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did... I'm terribly sorry. No,  I'll correct our files. Thank you. He scratches through another name. Three left. He dials  another number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard and his deputies inside the Prosthetic Clinic. Artificial limbs are being tested, fitted. A technician  fits a demonstration model on Biggs while Gerard and Pool work with the director of the institute and a data operat at the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The onearmed man. Missing the right or left hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. The operator enters that information. Dropping the number 250... as Poole continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble on phone. He hangs up and scratches through anothe name. Two left. He dials another number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poole looks up from her file to the computer screen. The  number drops to 117...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Location of the attachment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the report)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mid-humerus.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE'S LIST
dialogues.text: The next name is "Clive Driscoll." Kimble on phone, waits for answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... looking for your brother,  Clive. This is Ted Riley with the  high school reunion committee.  Believe it or not, 25 years is just  around the corner, and Clive's on  our list of lost souls. Information  gave me a number, but when I tried  it... WIDER to reveal Kimble on the pay phone. The scrap of pap is his list-of-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding?... Armed robbery. (forced laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard looks at the screen. The number drops to 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could take us a week to track  down every one of those names. Gerard picks up phone and dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevens... I've got a list of names  I want searched for criminal history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble stands on a sidewalk, staring at the imposing edif across the street. After a here-we-go breath, he starts  through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble waits for an elevator. It opens to reveal a pack o staring COPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comin' or not? Forcing his feet to move, Kimble boards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and pivots quickly. Elevator rises. Floor-indicator m deathly slow. Kimble feels the breath of a dozen COPS on his neck. And when his floor is mercifully about to arrive... Overhead lights flicker, and the elevator jars to a stop  between floors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, shit... Not now... Anybody  bring a deck of cards? Abruptly they're moving again. Kimble's heart restarts wi the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to visitor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth Three. No hands on the glass.  Five minutes maximum. Be advised that  under a Federal court ruling your  conversation can be recorded. Next. "Next" is Kimble. He steps to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name of inmate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive Driscoll. The Clearing Officer spins his clipboard around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign here, print your name, address,  and relationship to inmate below. (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-zero-ten. Driscoll, Clive R. (to Kimble)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be about five minutes. You can wait  in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard and Biggs cross the lobby and stop in front of the desk; flash their U.S. Marshal's ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to clerk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to see a prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifth floor. Gerard and Biggs head for the bank of elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hinky. Man risks everything to  find a man his own investigators  say doesn't exist. Something's really  hinky about this thing. Gerard looks at Biggs as they reach the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate that word. He hits the up button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearing Officer looks down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visitor for Driscoll...? Kimble is on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: CLEARING OFFICER
dialogues.text: Booth seven. No hands on the glass. Be advised... The Clearing Officer, head down, drones on - doesn't noti Kimble is already gone. Kimble strides down the row of chairs, rounds the last  partition to reach booth seven - and to stare at the  one-armed man, DRISCOLL, who waits there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who are you?

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Driscoll's face is different. Driscoll is a black man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, that's okay. Stick around a  few minutes, talk about whatever you want... But Kimble is gone. Driscoll calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... They're not exactly wired for  cable downstairs, y'know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble exits the visitor's area. He sees another crowd of COPS around the elevator again, opts for the door marked:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs and Gerard wait for the elevator. Finally Gerard's  had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're the damn stairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's five flights!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you wait. He finds the door and starts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble descending. Doors open and close throughout the  stairwell but the traffic is light...

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: Climbing the stairs. He reaches a landing - and skims  shoulders with Kimble, who pivots past on his way down. Amazingly, neither man reacts. Not yet. One flight above, Gerard's subconscious taps him on the  shoulder and brings him to a dead stop. He leans over the stairwell railing to spy... Kimble spiraling downward. From this vantage, it could be any dark-haired man. But still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a quick probe) Kimble. Others look up out of curiosity... but not Kimble. Two  landings below, he falters a step, then tries to regain  his step, keeps moving. But Gerard is pulling his Glock: The hitch in Kimble's  stride told him everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble! Kimble blitzes down the stairs. Gerard moves after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble throws open a fire door and starts across the lobb Sees two cops, quickly approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officers - there's a man in the  stairwell waving a gun and  screaming. The two cops rush to stairs and Kimble immediately moves toward the doors, fast but not running. Hoping to cloak  himself in civilians.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATORS
dialogues.text: Biggs' elevator has finally arrived and emptied. He lets woman on in front of him, oblivious to... Kimble moving... The revolving exit doors loom nearer ant nearer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cops see Gerard. Gerard holds up his badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U.S. Marshal! Get on the phone, call your commander, tell him there's a  top-fifteen warrant in the building.  Go. He shoves the cops out of the way and pounds downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble closing in on the door when suddenly a KLAXON HORN sounds. People stop in confusion. Automatically, the exit doors  begin closing. Biggs pushes his way off the elevator.  Kimble breaks into a sprint for the door.

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: Bursts out the stairwell door after Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble. Stop! But there's only one way of stopping Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Enters the revolving doors as a big man enters from the  outside. The big man sizes up the situation, realizes Kim is fleeing and just before Kimble exits - yanks on the do - trapping him partially inside the revolving door. Other doors seal electronically. Biggs charges back, sees Gerard. Kimble fights the heavy glass door. The big man resists - but slowly the crack widens. Gerard bulls through the cro shoves a man out of his line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down. down. everybody down! With adrenal effort, Kimble wrings his body through the  opening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and makes it outside - except for his foot - caught l in a bear trap, as the door locks down. Harrowed, Kimble back over his shoulder at... Gerard. Charging the glass doors. Civilians suck marble a clear out of Gerard's line of fire on Kimble. Gerard take

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble. Stop! It's Kimble's nightmare coming true. If he could chew off leg right now, he would. He pulls at his foot just as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard FIRES seven times in two seconds. Kimble goes down. SHOTS and SCREAMS ECHO around the lobby long beat, then Gerard rises. THROUGH GLASS studded with  bullet holes, he sees... Kimble rising... staring back. Equally astounded that he' alive. He runs free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the doors! Gerard pounds against the doors. Sees cratering in the  glass - and then sees flattened slugs all over the floor. It's bullet-proof glass. THROUGH the glass he sees Kimble rush across the street and disappear into the parade. Doors open and Gerard and his men follow. But Kimble has disappeared into the parade celebrations  outside. Blending in with the marchers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble leaves a cheap hotel early the next morning. He we a new set of clothes - jeans, sport coat and tie - than t day before, and the black hair coloring has been rinsed f his hair. He moves down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble uses a pay phone and stares through the window.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT HOUSE
dialogues.text: Across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the apartment the PHONE RINGS. No one is home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS nine, ten times. As Kimble waits he looks down at his list of five. The only name remaining is  Fredrick Sykes. He looks down the street - it seems clear - then his focu shifts to a man carrying two coffees. He approaches a car parked along the curb. The passenger - a woman - leans  across the seat and opens the door for him. He hands her a cup of coffee and as he starts to climb in he shifts something on his hip - we see the butt of a  handgun. Kimble hangs up and leaves through the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves across the roof and drops to fire escape beh Sykes' apartment. He looks in the window, steps back to s if anyone is looking, then pulls his fist back into his  sleeve and with one swift pop, BREAKS the GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sound. Slowly he moves into...

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Moving first toward the living room. The apartment is  modest. He stops by a photograph of a teenage girl. Another is a  boy in football uniform. The next one is a man in a  police uniform. Kimble freezes.

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY HIT
dialogues.text: Kimble struggles with the one-armed man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble struggles to recall the man's face. It could be hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble searching for clues to Sykes' identity. He opens  closets, wardrobe, bureau... reopens a drawer. There, in bottom he finds an old prosthetic arm.

dialogues.speaker: DESK
dialogues.text: Kimble looking through Sykes' desk drawers finds a packag of photographs. He opens them and quickly flips through.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHS
dialogues.text: A group of men on a business/vacation junket stand around large sportfish hung from the dock. Kimble keeps flipping through, suddenly stops and backs up and we see what stop him: The smiling face of Dr. Alexander Lentz.

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY HIT
dialogues.text: Nichols introduces Kimble to Lentz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard... Alex Lentz.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHS
dialogues.text: There are three photos of Lentz. Kimble slowly pulls one of the pack. As he slides it out we see a fish and on the other side we see... Sykes, wearing a prosthetic arm.

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY HIT
dialogues.text: Kimble struggles with intruder. This time we see his face clearly. It is Sykes.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHS, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: Kimble flips back to the earlier group photos and we see Devlin-MacGregor banner over the group shot.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Looks up. He's found the man he's looking for but also a possibility - that the murder wasn't just a random act of violence. Kimble digs through Sykes' top desk drawer. His mind reel He stops:

dialogues.speaker: PAYCHECK STUBS
dialogues.text: The Devlin-MacGregor Pharmaceutical logo in the top right corner. Payroll level four: Security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHONE RINGS. SECRETARY answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U.S. Marshal's office... Her expression changes to shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard is moving down the hall with a cup of coffee when  the Secretary appears at a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It' 9 Kimble on line three. Gerard moves quickly down the hall, mobilizing his troops as he runs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renfro, Biggs... They follow him into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard moves to phone as TECHNICIAN gives him nod he's ready. Gerard answers the phone and the trace begins.  Renfro supervises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Gerard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember what I told you in  the tunnel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me, you didn't kill your  wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what you said to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard is calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember you were pointing my gun  at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said, 'I don't care.'

dialogues.speaker: ON TRACING EQUIPMENT
dialogues.text: The numbers rush down. Technician reads the first set  to Renfro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the southside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Kimble... I'm not  trying to solve a puzzle here. I'm  just the poor working man that's  paid to hunt you down. The room is filling up with deputies. Poole, Biggs,  Stevens, Newman. Gerard watches the numbers as the second digit locks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in Pullman area... Fifteen  seconds for location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I am trying to solve the  puzzle, Gerard and I just found a  piece. Kimble takes the phone and bangs it down onto a table and we realize he is in Sykes' kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound startles Gerard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble? Kimble leaves the phone on the table and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't control this thing,  Kimble... Kimble? He thinks he hears FOOTSTEPS over the phone, realizes Kim has not hung up. What's Kimble doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Renfro)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? Renfro looks up from the address to Gerard, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. We've got a car there  right now. He picks up a phone.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: The two cops receive a radio report about Kimble and  quickly exit their car. They rush toward Sykes' building.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ALLEY
dialogues.text: While they move into the apartment, we see Kimble, fully  aware of them, slip away down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON LIST: Sykes. Lentz. Devlin-MacGregor. R.D.U.90.  Lines draw connections.

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY HIT
dialogues.text: Kimble and Chief Resident work feverishly to save patient

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This an R.D.U.90 patient? Kimble looks up at the Resident as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON TELEPHONE RECEIVER. It BUZZES off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name is Fredrick Sykes. 45. Ex cop . A hand comes INTO FRAME ant replaces the receiver on the  cradle. We WIDEN to find: Gerard. We see technicians  dusting room for prints. A FORENSIC TECH approaches Gerar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector, we're ready for you to  look at this. The Forensic Tech sits at desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble's prints are all over the  apartment, but the concentration  is here. The Tech takes out the check stubs, some papers; the pack of photos.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOS
dialogues.text: The Tech flips through the pack, stops on the Lentz/Sykes photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips through the pack but  paused here. He hands the Lentz/Sykes photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see the negatives. The Tech hands him the strip of negative film. Gerard hol it up to the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One's missing. Gerard stares at the photo as his RADIO SQUAWKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he comes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fredrick Sykes, the one-armed man, comes down the side  walk. He passes a car and hears the door open behind him. Biggs climbs out of the car and falls into step behind hi Sykes hears the footsteps but moves on up the stoop and  starts to enter his apartment, notices the front door  already open. Cops and Marshals in his house. Processing a crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on here?  Who are you people? He steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... sees Gerard in the kitchen. Gerard stares at Sykes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a break-in, Mr. Sykes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Gerard. U.S. Marshal's  Office. Sykes is caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning a fugitive named  Richard Kimble made a call from your apartment. Sykes is dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Kimble... I don't know a  Richard Kim - Poole produces a photo of Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... This is the doctor  who killed his wife... He claimed  the killer had a prosthetic limb.  You telling me he's coming after  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would he have a reason to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's that supposed to  mean? Because I have this? He lifts his prosthetic arm and stares at Gerard. Gerard  holds his look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, a year ago some people came  to see me. They asked me questions  about the night of the murder and  I'll tell you the same thing I told them. I wasn't even in town then.  I was on a business trip. Gerard continues moving around the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of business are you in,  Mr. Sykes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Independent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I work for a pharmaceutical  company. I handle security for its  top executives. Gerard holds up one of the fishing photographs with Lentz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea why Kimble would be  interested in these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just some doctors on a company  junket. Gerard puts the photos down with the one of Lentz on top. Sykes eyes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you mind if I talk to the cops  to see if anything's missing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By all means. Sykes moves off and Gerard pockets the Lentz/Sykes photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard crosses the street with Renfro and Biggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pulling our chain, Sam. If this was the guy Kimble was looking for,  why call us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble said he's putting together a  puzzle. We don't need to put it  together too, we just need to be  there when he gets to the next  piece. Gerard stops and looks back at Sykes' apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep somebody on him. If he moves  I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves through large medical library and turns into area marked: PHARMACOLOGY.

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACEUTICAL JOURNAL
dialogues.text: Pages turn as we get CLOSER on headings: "DRUGS PENDING  FDA APPROVAL..." Experimental and commercial names MOVE  PAST us... and at the end of the list we find: "PROVASIC  (RDU90) Developed by Devlin-MacGregor Pharmaceuticals".

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PERIODICAL
dialogues.text: Kimble opens to article entitled: "DEVLIN-MACGREGOR  EXPECTS PAYDIRT WITH PROVASIC." "Pharmaceutical company  plans to go public on introduction of new drug, Provasic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble looks up. Now he knows why someone tried to kill  him. He gathers more Devlin-Macgregor information  including a prospectus, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OPERATOR answers a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry sir, Dr. Nichols is at a  medical conference at the Hilton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very important I reach him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A meeting is underway around a board room table. An  ASSISTANT moves around the table and gives Nichols a  message with a number and "URGENT" written on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, they said it was an  emergency. Nichols excuses himself from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble answers a pay PHONE when it RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nichols on phone at the other end of the suite. The meeti continues behind him. As soon as he hears Kimble's voice, Nichols reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard. Yes... I'm on a hotel  phone. What's going on? He eyes the group in the other room, moves around the cor for more privacy. As he does we notice several of the men watching. They exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found him, Charlie. I found the  guy that killed Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all about a drug, Charlie. They  tried to kill me because of a drug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devlin-MacGregor and Lentz. Lentz  was supervising the R.D.U.90  protocol. He knew I'd found out the drug had problems. It's Lentz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, Lentz is dead. He died in  an auto accident last summer. Kimble is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you prove this about the drug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help. Call Mr. Roosevelt  and tell him I'm coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group of deputies and Gerard assemble around Gerard's information board. They've come armed with facts and  theories. Gerard orchestrates the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were Richard Kimble... Why  would you hunt for a one-armed man  you think killed your wife; find  hint then leave him and call us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To throw us off his trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless... What if you were a well  respected surgeon and wanted to kill  your wife? How would you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd hire a pro. Sight unseen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set it up to look like a robbery  gone bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you find him? Look in the  phone book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe through a company you did some  business with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a pharmaceutical company.  Someone in security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the night of his wife's murder,  Kimble attended a hospital benefit  sponsored by Devlin-Macgregor  Pharmaceutical - Sykes' company. Gerard places a Devlin-Macgregor card onto his board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sykes claims he was out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And company records support that he  was on a business trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an easy fix. So let's say he  was in town. Did the job. Everything  goes as planned with one problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of looking like a robbery  gone bad, Kimble ends up being the  one accused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... tried, convicted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and the hit man gets away clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Kimble returns to hunt for and  find the hit man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? To share the blame? He'd still  go to prison. Gerard moves to the board. He takes down a card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're underestimating the power of  the good doctor. It would be his  word against... Sykes'. Who would  you believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what does Kimble do next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get help. Gerard pins the card to the board and looks at Renfro. It says: "NICHOLS"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevens, check phone records for  Sykes and Kimble. Gerard moves to the door and Renfro follows. As he's  leaving he hands the photo of Lentz and Sykes to Biggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out who this guy is. He leaves. Biggs hands the photo to Newman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I get all the great jobs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble enters the hospital through the loading dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. ROOSEVELT, an ancient research assistant, opens the  door to Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure is good to see you again,  Dr. Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Roosevelt... Been a long  time. Roosevelt closes the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roosevelt brings Kimble a file marked: "R.D.U.90"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the R.D.U.90 file and  samples. Dr. Nichols said you  needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Roosevelt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop stares up at Sykes' house from across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sykes watches the cops in the car outside. He moves to th phone and dials number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to report a fire; No, it's  not my place, it's a couple doors  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves down hall and quietly enters a small researc lab in the university. Dr. Wahlund sits behind her micros and doesn't see him until he touches her on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God... Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loaned you something once, Kath,  and I need them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sykes, dressed in coat and tie, prepares to leave apartme Somewhere in the distance we hear: FIRE ENGINE SIRENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop stares at Sykes' window when suddenly we hear FIR SIRENS, and a pair of fire trucks turn onto the street an pull up across the street from the unmarked car -blocking the view of Sykes' house. Firemen climb down and move to nearby building. The street begins to fill up with people The cop stares at the commotion directly behind him. He  becomes so engrossed in the action like everyone else tha he fails to see Sykes, using the distraction, exit his  apartment and walk calmly away from the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newman studies the photograph of Lentz and Sykes under a  magnifying glass.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE ON PHOTO OF LENTZ
dialogues.text: We see the logo on Lentz' shirt says: "C M H"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sykes stands at a phone booth, finishes a call, then move up the stairs to board an el train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A conference breaks up and Nichols moves down hallway. He slows when he sees Gerard and Renfro waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gerard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor. Could I have a minute? He opens the door to an empty meeting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard, Nichols and Renfro. Nichols stares at a photo cop of the Sykes and Lentz fishing photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a security specialist at  Devlin-Macgregor Pharmaceuticals. Kimble broke into his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know him. You're getting  pretty desperate aren't you, Mr.  Gerard. I told you, you wouldn't  find Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kimble hasn't come back to you  for help, has he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. And it seems like we've been  over this ground before. Now if  you'll excuse me. Nichols moves to the door. Gerard looks again at the phot then stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Nichols. Do you know the other man in the photograph? Nichols stops, looks at Lentz and lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw him before. He leaves. Gerard watches him. Renfro looks down and sees flyer which says Nichols is  slated to talk that evening in the grand ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Advances in Nuclear Tissue and  Pathology Research," by Dr. Charles  Nichols. (to Gerard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet they line up to hear that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newman and Biggs enter the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICROSCOPIC POV: Cell structure.

dialogues.speaker: ON WAHLUND
dialogues.text: She works the fluorescent stains. Makes notes. Kimble helps load the next sample.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half the people in the study were  indigents. No follow-up, no baseline  on them. Who could say they didn't  come into the study with bad livers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one on the right is one of the  samples you sent me. It shows a lot  of perriportal inflammation loaded  with eosinophils. When you see that  with the accumulation of bile it's  a classic for -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - drug induced hepatitis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed. Now look at this. She positions a second slide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the study, this is a  slice from the same liver. Kimble studies the slide. The tissue difference is marked different, clearer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly not from the same tissue.  In fact. She yields the microscope to Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See this small area of bile duct  proliferation? Von Meyenberg's  Complex. Occurs in only 2% of the  population. But it's in every one  of your five samples. Kimble looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's statistically impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because they're all from the  same liver. She smiles at Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newman shows the photo to a 40s clerk, BETTY. She looks a the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Lentz. A pathologist. I  only remember him because he died  last summer. Biggs and Newman exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody down in pathology who might  know something about the guy? Betty looks at the clock, it's after 6 p.m. Dicey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kinda late to catch anyone,  but you might go by the morgue.  There's an old guy down there  who's been around forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sykes steps off an elevator at Chicago Memorial Hospital. And starts down a hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newman and Biggs move down the empty hallway... this long shot has never felt longer. They find the morgue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what I want to do before  dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roosevelt working near the autopsy tables when the two  marshals enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Mr. Roosevelt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're United States Marshals. We're  trying to find out some information  about a pathologist, named Lentz. He  used to be on staff here. Roosevelt suddenly goes on the defensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we heard. We wanted to know if  he knew or had any contact with Dr.  Richard Kimble? On the mention of Kimble, Roosevelt becomes visibly nervo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I haven't seen Dr. Kimble. Biggs and Newman exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a probe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I asked, sir. I just  wanted to know if Dr. Kimble and Dr.  Lentz knew each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't know. Excuse me, I got to go. He moves away from the autopsy table. Biggs stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're lying to us. Roosevelt looks from one marshal to the other as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kathy packs up evidence, Kimble looks through the repo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd be home free if I hadn't been  leaning on them to account for the  livers I was seeing. And I wouldn't  have seen the livers if I hadn't  told the guys on my service to call me when they had cases that were  bleeding excessively in surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big bucks. One schmuck standing in  the way. Easy, get rid of him and  his wife. But why Lentz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? He's one of the original  patent holders. Toss the samples I  sent, replace them with healthy  samples, issue the path report on  the healthy stuff-piece of cake. Kimble notices something in the report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did Lentz die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, last summer sometime. August...  Why? Kimble looks up from the protocol report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because a good third of the samples  Lentz approved were signed after he  died. Kathy comes to look at the report. Lentz's signature is  on reports dated October, November, December.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else used Lentz's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pathologist at Devlin-Macgregor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't have had the access.  They would have needed someone at  the hospital. Kimble opens the Devlin-Macgregor prospectus he took from the medical library and opens it to the beginning. A phot gets his attention. He takes the bag and starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see an old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard at his board. The cards form a triangle: Sykes  Devlin-Macgregor - Lentz with Kimble at the apex. He star at the board. Poole comes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Newman. Line two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble slips down corridor. We see someone following him. It is Sykes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newman on portable phone. Behind him Biggs questions Mr.  Roosevelt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old guy didn't know where he was  going. But he picked up some tissue  samples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tissue samples? Gerard goes to his board. Renfro listens on the speakerph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... From a drug study. And signed  for by Dr. Charles Nichols. Renfro and Gerard exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nichols also knew Lentz. He was a  pathologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was covering for Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Renfro)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get CPD to bring in Sykes. Gerard stares at the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves through steam tunnel beneath the hospital. It is lined with old furniture and supplies. A few moment later we see Sykes following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cordial HOST steps up to the microphone. The room is  filled with doctors seated at tables around the room. It the end of a dinner symposium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight to close our conference,  we're honored to hear a report from  one of the most respected men in  his field...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble exits the hospital and moves toward Hospital E1 St

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Host continues his introduction of the keynote spe we PAN the DAIS of distinguished medical men and women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He is the A. Jude Robinson  Fellow and Administrative Chief of  Pathology at Chicago Memorial  Hospital... and just recently has  been appointed member of the board  of directors for Devlin-Macgregor  Pharmaceuticals. Please welcome... ... and STOP ON Charles Nichols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Dr. Charles Nichols. Nichols rises to applause and moves to the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble starts up the stairs to the station just as a trai is coming in. Kimble moves down the platform and boards t downtown train. Just before the doors close Sykes steps o the last car. The train moves out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard stares at his board. Stevens comes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked Sykes' calls for the last  two years against Kimble's like you  asked and found nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. It was a thought. He goes back to the board but Stevens isn't finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when I cross-checked Kimble's  phone records... one came up. Gerard looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble called Sykes. (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renfro! Get C.P.D. to bring in Sykes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night of his wife's murder -  seven-thirty in the evening from  his car. Gerard stares at the deputy, thinking - something doesn't click. Stevens sees the empty stare, then Gerard looks  back at his board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the phone record right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poole! Bring me Kimble's arrest  report, now. (to Stevens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Stevens... I believe you. Poole enters with Kimble's arrest transcript. Gerard take the transcript as Renfro appears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, C.P.D. just checked Sykes'  apartment. He's not there. As Gerard looks up, we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sits in the front car. There are very few other riders. A man with newspaper sits across the car reading. The  headlines facing Kimble say: "KIMBLE IN CHICAGO". Kimble' booking photo stares back at him. Kimble reacts to the headline, looks away as the man turn the pages. The man looks over the newspaper at Kimble, then goes bac to reading. A moment later he folds the paper back to the front page. The man looks up from the paper and looks at Kimble again then down. Coolly the man folds the paper, tucks it under his arm,  stands, looks through the car, then moves into one of the rear cars. Kimble looks out the window - hoping desperately for his  car to reach the station. He keeps his head turned until  the man is gone.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH CENTER OF TRAIN
dialogues.text: From the center of Kimble's car we see the man with the  newspaper move up to a TRANSIT COP. They begin talking. Kimble stands, coming INTO the SHOT. We see him watching  the discussion. Suddenly a man, sitting in the rear of the car, stands  and blocks Kimble's view of the Cop. It's Sykes. His gun  is drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back up. Move to the door, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transit Cop moves past the man with the newspaper toward  Kimble's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is transit unit, 23. I have a  possible sighting of Richard Kimble.  Northbound coming into the Balbo  station. Request immediate back-up  at the station. He moves toward the connecting door to Kimble's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train is not yet to the station. He has no escape.  Sykes moves toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my stop, Doc. Kimble stares hard at Sykes. He steps toward the side  exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, it's my stop, too. Suddenly the door behind Sykes opens and the Transit Cop  enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble. (to Sykes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, move away from him. Sykes - the gun tucked next to his side - turns. The Cop sees Sykes' gun, reacts... But Sykes FIRES first, shoots the cop FOUR TIMES. As the Cop falls, Sykes turns quickly to finish Kimble.  But Kimble pulls the emergency brake over the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brakes lock. The TRAIN SCREECHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers are thrown off their feet. Bags and briefcases go flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sykes is thrown forward toward Kimble who holds onto a ba for balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train stops just short of the station. Only the first two windows of the front car are over the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sykes is thrown to the floor - the gun slips from his gra Kimble moves for the gun as Sykes comes up, catches Kimbl in the stomach, knocks him back. The fight carries on  throughout the car. Kimble reaches the gun first, lifts it in his left hand a aims at Sykes. Sykes sees the gun in Kimble's hand and  almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SYKES
dialogues.text: Go ahead. You don't have it in you . For a moment Kimble almost fires, but instead he takes th gun in his right hand and whips it across Sykes' face.  Then hits Sykes again and again with the butt of the gun, driving him down the length of the car, knocking him almo unconscious. Kimble tucks the gun in his belt and moves to the Transit Cop. He checks for a pulse - there is none. The Cop is de Kimble takes the handcuffs and keys from the case on the  Cop's belt. He reaches for Sykes' wrist, drags him to the Cop and cuffs Sykes to the dead Cop. He pockets the keys and grabs Sykes' hair, pulls his face off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as easy as Helen, was it? (slams Sykes' head down, leaves)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed your stop. He moves to the front of the car with Sykes' and the Tran Cop's guns out. People back out of his way. He moves to  where the first two windows extend over the platform, kic out the front window and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... drops to the station platform. Kimble lowers his head moves down the uncrowded platform to the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The report comes off the scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... units in the vicinity of Balbo  Street station. Be alert to possible  sighting of Richard Kimble... Gerard, Renfro and Poole trade looks. Gerard moves toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balbo station. That's -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poole, get Biggs and Newman. They're gone as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cruisers pull outside the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As transit police move up the escalator to the platform,  Kimble moves unnoticed through the underground mall  beneath the hotel. Deposits the guns into a mail box and  keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renfro driving, Gerard and Pool in car. Report comes over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... all units in vicinity of Balbo  E1. Officer down. Repeat, officer  down. Man leaving scene with two  guns matches description of Richard  Kimble... Gerard looks out the window, he knows what this means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to himself)
