dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble moves up escalators from the underground station  into the Hilton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disheveled and driven, he moves from the escalators to th lobby - checks the list of hospitality suites and sees  board which indicates Nichols speech in the rooftop  ballroom. He moves on to the main elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nichols speaking. As he talks we MOVE TO...

dialogues.speaker: TABLE OF MEN
dialogues.text: Listening - the same men we saw in the hospitality suite  when Nichols talked to Kimble. As we MOVE TIGHTER ON one  of the men, we notice his name tag says: Board of  Directors... Devlin-MacGregor Pharmaceuticals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble rides alone to the rooftop ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard's car pulls up in front of the hotel. Police are  controlling pedestrians. Newman and Biggs, already decked out in Kevlar, meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.P.D. just reported -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard. Was it Kimble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conflicting reports, but the cops  are considering him a shooter. Heavily-armed CPD units pull up. Gerard stares at the pol presence. He starts toward the hotel where Kelly is  conferring with Kevlar-decked police captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witnesses say he entered hotel from  the subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I want it locked down. Start  on the lower levels. The captain moves off. Gerard intercepts the cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my man in there, Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not since he took down one of ours,  Gerard. This is a police matter, now. Stay, the hell, out of it. Kelly moves off. Gerard watches him a moment then he look up to the roof. Newman hands Gerard his belt with his  backup piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, I know where he's going. He moves into the hotel with his deputies.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. / INT. HOTEL
dialogues.text: A) C.P.D. cruisers arriving. Cops deploying to points of  entry. Security guards keying shut parking garage and  blocking stairwells. B) Helicopter with police sharpshooters takes off from  Meigs Field downtown and heads for the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble exits the elevators and moves down the corridor to the ballroom. A man tries to stop him at the doors, Kimbl simply moves him out of the way and opens the doors to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nichols moves to the last of his speech as Kimble enters  at the rear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And I especially would like to  thank my researchers who helped me... Nichols stops his speech - stunned to see Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Charlie? Surprised? Kimble begins moving down the aisle past the tables of  doctors toward the podium. We see the faces of Kimble's colleagues and friends from  the ballroom sequence earlier. At first no one notices  Kimble but as he makes his way toward the dais, the  applause fades and then room quiets. Whispers of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Richard. It's Kimble. Stunned expressions. Kimble continues to the front, talking to Nichols as if  the room were empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Lentz died, you were the only  one that had access to the  pathology reports. Nichols remains calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reports? What are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You switched the samples and  falsified the reports so R.D.U.90  could get approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, I don't know what you're  talking about?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a set of the original  samples. Nichols stares at Kimble and for the first time we see a  flicker of concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost pulled it off, Charlie.  But I know all about it now, and I  can prove it. Nichols and Kimble hold a look. Nichols turns to the audi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen. My friend, as  you can see, is obviously not well.  Richard, if you want to talk -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't come here to talk Nichols leaves the dais and heads toward the exit. Kimble tracks along with him - moving through the tables passing the table with the Devlin-MacGregor board of  directors. They are disturbed by this situation.

dialogues.speaker: ON NICHOLS
dialogues.text: Moves through a door and exits into...

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Kimble follows moving through the tables and people to  reach the door. As soon as he's gone there are calls for "security." Doct move for the exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard, Renfro, Newman, Biggs and Poole move into the lob Police move to cover the lower floors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.P.D. has the perimeter, hotel  security has the parking structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them keep busy down below.  Newman, get with security. See if  you can locate Kimble from the  monitors. Keep in radio contact. Newman branches off to Hotel Security. The rest follow  Gerard to the rooftop elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROARING over Chicago skyline. The bright red sign of the  Hilton Hotel looms ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nichols moves down hallway and turns into a hospitality  suite. A moment later Kimble follow and enters the...

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITALITY SUITE
dialogues.text: ... and is immediately smashed with a chair by Nichols.  Kimble goes flying, stunned. Nichols locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your best quality, Richard, is that  you don't give up - Nichols pulls Kimble to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... even when it's clearly in your  best interest to... He hits him again, drives him back into the library. Kimble tries to recover as Nichols relentlessly stays on  him. He pulls him up, slams him against the fire escape  doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew that I'd have to kill  you. He drives a blow into Kimble's stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I must thank you for giving me  200 witnesses tonight who will  support me... when I tell them it  was self-defense... He shoves Kimble through the door out into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and almost over the railing. Kimble grabs the rail to keep from dropping to the street. Nichols closes on him,  but Kimble rolls away at the last minute and knocks  Nichols back against the other side of fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed your chance, Charlie... Nichols charges Kimble, but Kimble drives him back with  two crushing blows that send Nichols down the stairs. Kimble moves down the stairs after him - passing under a  security camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room lined with security monitors. Two security personn sit in front of their console. Newman stands behind them. On screen: We see Kimble moving down the stairs toward  Nichols, who pulls himself to his feet. Newman stands in front of the screen, talks to his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got Kimble on the roof with  Nichols. Southeast exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard and deputies Poole, Biggs, and Renfro around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep and eye on him. Biggs has roof plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are four exits to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want them covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nichols rises to his feet, swings, but Kimble blocks the  blow and lands another that sends Nichols down another  set of stairs to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took everything away from me...  for money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard and the marshals reach the ballroom floor. The  elevator doors open to a flood of confused and disoriente doctors trying to escape. The marshals wade through, meet up with two hotel security guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble pulls Nichols to his feet. They are silhouetted by the lights of the city skyline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know, Charlie... was it  worth it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing is bigger than even you  think, Richard. You can't stop it. He hits Nichols again with tremendous force, knocking him against the parapet. Nichols stares over the edge - the  street appears far below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard and his deputies work their way into the ballroom. The deputies move to separate areas. Several doctors poin them in the direction Kimble and Nichols fled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newman stands in front the security monitors and watches  Kimble and Nichols on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble reaches Nichols and draws to hit him again as the  HELICOPTER suddenly ROARS over the rooftop. Its beam hits the two men and a VOICE booms from the helicopter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicago police. Freeze. In the instant of shock, Nichols knees Kimble and bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard moves down connecting hallway where a couple of  concerned doctors are trying to open the door to the  hospitality suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to doctors)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear the hallway. (to security)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that door open. The door opens and Gerard moves quickly through the  hospitality suite for the rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to security)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay at this door. He moves through the door to the roof alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newman watching the security monitors sees Kimble and  Nichols. On another monitor we see Gerard exit the suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nichols runs. Kimble recovers, sees Gerard moving down the fire escape  toward him, and Nichols escaping. He goes after Nichols. The helicopter circles back over the roof, illuminating t rooftop in its million-candle-power beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a visual on Kimble. He's  running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly listens on his ratio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble chases Nichols down the roof as BULLETS from the  helicopter rip into the air conditioning duct next to Kim The helicopter swings out to keep Kimble in sight.

dialogues.speaker: ON GERARD
dialogues.text: Gerard hits the bottom of the fire escape and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a United States Marshal.  Get that helicopter out of here!

dialogues.speaker: NICHOLS
dialogues.text: He moves away among the duct work. Kimble follows. Gerard continues after Kimble. The helicopter circles and follows from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renfro triggers his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a U.S. Marshal out there.  Hold your fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOWING Kimble. Its beam tracking Kimble across the  rooftop. He moves through the blowers and duct work.  Kimble is gaining ground on Nichols.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHARPSHOOTER
dialogues.text: He is about to fire when he hears through his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your fire. The shooter pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard rushes across the roof toward Kimble.

dialogues.speaker: NICHOLS
dialogues.text: He is almost to the end of the roof when Kimble tackles  him. The two men crash against sloped glass roof of an  elevator housing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the shaft - an elevator moves toward the roof. It  stops on the floor ten feet below the roof. THROUGH the  glass roof we see the doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charges toward -

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Who slams Nichols hard against the glass. The WIRED  GLASS CRACKS and bellies with the form of their bodies. Nichols' head rocks from the impact. The GLASS GROANS. The wire stresses. The caulking begins  to drop. Nichols struggles but Kimble has him in control. Slams  him down hard again.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Circles, illuminates the struggle in its spotlight and  Gerard closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors close and the car beneath the  skylight begins to descend.

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: Pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble! Kimble slams Nichols one more time against the glass  and the wire holding the glass gives way, sending Kimble  and Nichols into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble and Nichols, locked together, fall down the shaft  and crash onto the roof of the descending elevator car.  Nichols crashes through the ceiling into the car. Kimble  hits and slides across the roof to the edge, stopping  himself, just before he falls into the shaft. An  elevator car rushes toward him out of the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard reaches the elevator housing, looks down into the  shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble's car disappears into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nichols pulls himself to his feet. Hits the emergency  stop and the doors open. He disappears into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a huge industrial laundry room. Steam rises from the  giant machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble drops from the ceiling into the car and moves  carefully into the laundry. ... like an industrial jungle. Dimly lit, filled with  DEAFENING MACHINERY. Five hundred pound bags of laundry  move from a network of ceiling tracks to a pair of  heavyduty conveyor belts and two thirty-foot long washers ... At the other end of the washers, hydraulic presses  stamp out three-foot diameter "cakes" which are moved by  conveyor and dollies to automated dryers. The NOISE is DEAFENING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerard comes down back stairwell. Followed by Renfro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did the elevator stop?

dialogues.speaker: NEWMAN IN SECURITY
dialogues.text: Newman checks the computer board for the elevator  position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Level five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nichols pushes through the hanging laundry bags toward an exit, tries the door. It is secured with a collapsible  grating with a padlock. He looks up, keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Notices the swinging bags, follows Nichols' trail. He  stops to get his bearings, sees shadow at the far end of  the room between the two washers. Kimble closes in, movin between the large conveyors.

dialogues.speaker: SORTING ROOM
dialogues.text: Gerard enters sorting room with Renfro. He sees two sorte standing by a small conveyor as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here. He and Renfro move around the corner where a laundry  worker is hooking a 500 lb bag of lines onto the overhead rail. A hydraulic lift, operated by a hanging on/off  switch raises the bag on a yellow steel I-beam. The worke takes one look at Gerard and abandons his station. Gerard, Biggs and Renfro move to the closed doors of the  main room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Renfro)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going in. Give me five  minutes. Keep C.P.D. out. He draws his Glock, opens the door and enters the main  room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to end of washers, using the machines as cover. He sees the shadow again takes a pole leaning against the dryer as a weapon, turns the corner and is about to belt  him when he realizes it's not Nichols, but a laundry work Kimble moves away from the terrified man, when he hears a voice from the other end of the laundry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (above the din)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble! Kimble reacts to Gerard's voice, moves away.

dialogues.speaker: ON NICHOLS
dialogues.text: Moving behind machinery, sees light at far end of the roo where Gerard enters.

dialogues.speaker: ON GERARD
dialogues.text: The door closes automatically behind Gerard and Renfro. They enter the noisy main room and separate. Renfro moves up the far side of the room, Gerard up the center. Both  move slowly through the maze of bags, carts, automated  equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... There is no way out of here. The building is locked down.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Moves instinctively back into the machinery and carts nea the conveyor belts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble... I know about Nichols. I  know about Sykes. Kimble stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Nichols borrowed your car the  night of the murder and called  Sykes from it.

dialogues.speaker: RENFRO
dialogues.text: Separated from Gerard. He hears a NOISE behind him - a ba comes down the track at break-neck speed, Renfro spins,  dodges it, gets his bearings and continues.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Listening. He watches the movement of bags as he did with Nichols.

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: Moving through the forest of massive bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That's why there was no forced  entry at your house. He'd used your  keys.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Realizing what Gerard knows. Considering his next move.

dialogues.speaker: NICHOLS
dialogues.text: Also listening. He realizes Gerard now knows he's the  killer. He moves behind the water softener tanks and  chemicals - and spots Renfro - and something else -the  hanging control for the I-beam.

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: Moves carefully. Another bag comes down the track. He  dodges it and steps into an open track. From here he can  see straight back toward the washers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble... Come meet me out here.

dialogues.speaker: ON RENFRO
dialogues.text: He steps out and then back as a bag shoots by. He ducks  under the bag - into the next track and suddenly hears a  WHIRRING sound behind him. Renfro turns as an I-beam come rushing down the open track and knocks him to the floor,  opening a gash across the side of his head. He lays still

dialogues.speaker: NICHOLS
dialogues.text: Steps out of the shadows, turns him over exposing his emp shoulder harness and takes the gun from Renfro's hand.  Nichols moves toward Gerard with the gun.

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: Oblivious to this action, moves on, passes the conveyor  belts. He makes one last appeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to quit running... if you  don't, you know I'll stop you. He  listens, there is no answer.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBLE
dialogues.text: Starts to move out to meet Gerard, sees Renfro down. His  shoulder harness is empty. He knows Nichols is armed.

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: Moves into the alley between the two giant washers. He  pauses, looks back, then continues, when he turns his bac on us...

dialogues.speaker: NICHOLS
dialogues.text: Steps INTO FRAME behind him and slowly takes aim. Just  before he fires however he hears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Chuckles... Nichols turns toward the voice as Kimble swings the stick and clocks him - sending the gun skittering on the floor  behind Gerard.

dialogues.speaker: GERARD
dialogues.text: Turns on the sound and finds his gun trained on Kimble  with Nichols at his feet, unconscious. He realizes  instantly that Kimble saved his life and lowers his gun. Kimble, exhausted, leans against the washer. They hold a look as deputies and police flood into the  room surrounding Kimble and handcuffing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicago Police hold back crowds of onlookers on Michigan  Avenue. Police cars and vans, television news trucks vie  for space in front of the Hilton Towers. Dr. Charles Nichols, on a stretcher, loaded into an  ambulance. The doors close. REPORTERS and television cameramen line the sidewalk  giving reports and interviewing doctors from the ballroom We PICK UP pieces of their reports as we MOVE PAST them  TOWARD the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... As we reported a few minutes  ago, the saga of once-prominent  Chicago surgeon, Dr. Richard Kimble,  who escaped from an Illinois  Corrections bus, took a strange twist this evening when Dr. Kimble  was captured at the Chicago Hilton... ANOTHER REPORTER continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... there are unconfirmed reports  from police of new evidence which  may exonerate Kimble while  implicating some of the biggest  names in medicine... The doors to the police van close amid a flurry of  photographs. A third reporter interviews a STUNNED DOCTOR from the  ballroom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just walked in... We didn't know  what he was going to do. My wife  was very frightened... The next  thing I knew cops were charging in  and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimble, in handcuffs, is escorted by Biggs, Newman, Poole and Gerard, out of the hotel into the waiting chaos.  Renfro, his head bandaged, is helped by paramedics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as the group exits the hotel. Television lights  flood the scene. Kimble lowers his head. Reporters crowd  forward, yelling questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kimble, is it true you can prove  your innocence! Gerard wants the crowd controlled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to police)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them back. The marshals ant cops clear a line for Kimble to get into a waiting car away from the media. Biggs opens the back  door and helps Kimble inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your head, Dr. Kimble. Newman climbs in behind the wheel. Gerard in the back nex to Kimble. He leans out the window and motions to Poole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Poole)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poole, you got that thing? (to Kimble)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your hands. Kimble pauses, then holds up his wrists and Gerard unlock Kimble's handcuffs. Poole hands an ice-pack over the seat. Gerard places the  pack on Kimble' 9 bruised and battered hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of those hands, Doc,  you're going to need them again  soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you told me 'you didn't  care.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, don't spread it around. They share a look of mutual respect as the car pulls away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car carrying Kimble pulls onto Michigan Avenue headin back downtown. As we PULL BACK we see Kimble's car - at  first alone on the great avenue - then gradually joined  by other cars until finally becoming integrated in the  traffic, movement and lights of the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE END
